original: khams dang mtshan nyid @37b tshul bzhin dang // tshul min nyon mongs tha ma yin //
analyzed: khams dang mtshan nyid @37b tshul bzhin dang // tshul min nyon mongs tha ma yin //
translated: Elements, characteristics, proper mental attention, improper mental attention, and the final one is defilement.

original: sa gsum po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sa gsum po 'di dag ni /
translated: These three realms are to be understood as established🔽by the establishment of the designation of elements, the establishment of the designation of characteristics, the establishment of the designation of proper mental attention, the establishment of the designation of improper mental attention,

original: khams gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshan nyid gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: khams gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshan nyid gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: and the establishment of the designation of defilement.🔽In brief, they are established🔽by the establishment of the designation of the elements, the establishment of the designation of characteristics, the establishment of the designation of proper mental attention, the establishment of the designation of improper mental attention,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: and the establishment of the designation of defilement.🔽The summary verses:🔽Number, location, measure,🔽life span, enjoyments,🔽birth, bodies,

original: sdom la / grangs dang gnas dang tshad rnams dang // tshe yi tshad dang longs spyod dang // skye ba dang ni lus rnams dang // rgyu dang rkyen rnams rgya cher ro //
analyzed: sdom la / grangs dang gnas dang tshad rnams dang // tshe yi tshad dang longs spyod dang // skye ba dang ni lus rnams dang // rgyu dang rkyen rnams rgya cher ro //
translated: causes and conditions are extensive.

original: khams gdags pa rnam par gdags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams gdags pa rnam par gdags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the establishment of the designation of elements?

original: de ni rnam par brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as eightfold:

original: grangs rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas gzhan rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can gyi tshad rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can de dag nyid kyi tshe'i tshad rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can de dag nyid kyi longs spyod dang /
analyzed: grangs rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas gzhan rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can gyi tshad rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can de dag nyid kyi tshe'i tshad rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can de dag nyid kyi longs spyod dang /
translated: the presentation of the realms, the presentation of the abodes, the presentation of the measure of sentient beings, the presentation of the measure of the life-span of those sentient beings, the presentation of the enjoyments and resources of those sentient beings,

original: yongs su spyod pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / skye ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / lus rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su spyod pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / skye ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / lus rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the presentation of birth, the presentation of the body, and the presentation of causes and conditions.

original: de la grangs rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de la grangs rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: Here is the presentation of the realms:

original: khams ni gsum ste /
analyzed: khams ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three realms:

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te /
translated: the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: khams 'di dag ni gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: khams 'di dag ni gtogs pa yin no //
translated: These realms are included.

original: thabs dang bcas pas 'jig tshogs 'gog pa /
analyzed: thabs dang bcas pas 'jig tshogs 'gog pa /
translated: The cessation of the perishing aggregates, along with the means,

original: zag pa med pa'i khams spros pa med pa ni ma gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i khams spros pa med pa ni ma gtogs pa yin no //
translated: the uncontaminated realm, and the unelaborated realm are not included.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag dang / gzugs kyi khams nas bsam gtan dang po las /🔽bsam gtan khyad par can snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba dang bcas pa ma gtogs pa ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag dang / gzugs kyi khams nas bsam gtan dang po las / bsam gtan khyad par can snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba dang bcas pa ma gtogs pa ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa'o //
translated: The entire realm of desire and the realm of form, with the exception of the first meditation and the special meditation,🔽are stages with both applied and sustained thought.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba dang bcas pa ni rtog pa med pa dpyod pa tsam gyi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba dang bcas pa ni rtog pa med pa dpyod pa tsam gyi ste /
translated: The special meditation and the meditation with birth have neither applied thought nor sustained thought.

original: 'ga' zhig gis de bsgoms na tshangs pa chen po nyid 'thob bo //🔽bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis de bsgoms na tshangs pa chen po nyid 'thob bo // bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzung ste /
translated: If one cultivates this meditation, one obtains the status of Mahābrahmā.🔽The rest of the realm of form, beginning with the second meditation,

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams mtha' dag ni rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa @38a * //🔽yang med pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams mtha' dag ni rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa @38a * // yang med pa'i sa'o //
translated: and the entire realm of the formless have neither applied thought nor sustained thought.🔽They are called stages without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: de la rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshul gyis rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: de la rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshul gyis rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa zhes bya'o /
translated: They are called stages without applied thought and without sustained thought because one is detached from applied thought and sustained thought.

original: kun tu dpyod pa med pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kun tu dpyod pa med pas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that they are not investigated at all,

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa rnams kyang /
translated: because those who are not free from attachment to the desire realm

original: man ngag yid la byed pa'i khyad par gyis yid kyi rgyu ba res 'ga' rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: man ngag yid la byed pa'i khyad par gyis yid kyi rgyu ba res 'ga' rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med par yang 'gyur la /
translated: sometimes have mental activity that is free of investigation and analysis due to the special mental attention of instruction.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba yang rtog pa dang dpyod pa kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba yang rtog pa dang dpyod pa kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the desire realm sometimes have investigation and analysis arise.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is like

original: der skyes pa rnams dang langs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: der skyes pa rnams dang langs pa rnams la'o //
translated: those born there and those who have arisen from meditative attainment.

original: de la zag pa med pa'i khams ni /🔽'dus byas gang snyoms par 'jug pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa med pa'i khams ni / 'dus byas gang snyoms par 'jug pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The uncontaminated realm🔽is the conditioned realm subsumed by meditative attainment.

original: de la yang bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa yin te /
analyzed: de la yang bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa yin te /
translated: The first absorption is the level that possesses investigation and analysis.

original: rtog pa dpyod pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs nas /
analyzed: rtog pa dpyod pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs nas /
translated: Having focused on the suchness of phenomena that are the basis of investigation and analysis,

original: de la snyoms par 'jug gi rtog pa rgyu bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la snyoms par 'jug gi rtog pa rgyu bas ni ma yin te /
translated: one enters meditative attainment on that, but not through the movement of investigation.

original: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: de la gnas gzhan rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas gzhan rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: The arrangement of the abodes is as follows.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni gnas gzhan sum cu rtsa drug po rnams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni gnas gzhan sum cu rtsa drug po rnams te /
translated: The desire realm has thirty-six abodes.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i gnas brgyad la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po'i gnas brgyad la 'di lta ste /
translated: There are eight great hells:

original: yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'joms dang / du 'bod dang / du 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa'o //
analyzed: yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'joms dang / du 'bod dang / du 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa'o //
translated: Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghāta, Raurava, Mahāraurava, Tapana, Pratāpana, and Avīci.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag gi thad kar dpag tshad khri'i pha rol na /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag gi thad kar dpag tshad khri'i pha rol na /
translated: In front of each of these great hells, at a distance of ten thousand leagues,

original: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba'i gnas brgyad yod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba'i gnas brgyad yod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: there are eight cold hells:

original: chu bur can dang / chu bur rdol ba dang / so thams thams pa dang / kyi hud zer ba dang / aa cu zer ba dang / autpal ltar gas pa dang / pad ma ltar gas pa dang / pad ma ltar gas pa chen po'o //
analyzed: chu bur can dang / chu bur rdol ba dang / so thams thams pa dang / kyi hud zer ba dang / aa cu zer ba dang / autpal ltar gas pa dang / pad ma ltar gas pa dang / pad ma ltar gas pa chen po'o //
translated: Arbuda, Nirarbuda, Aṭaṭa, Hahava, Huhuva, Utpala, Padma, and Mahāpadma.

original: yang sos ni 'di nas dpag tshad sum khri nyis stong gi 'og na yod do //
analyzed: yang sos ni 'di nas dpag tshad sum khri nyis stong gi 'og na yod do //
translated: The Reviving Hell is located thirty-two thousand leagues below here.

original: de'i 'og na dpag tshad bzhi stong bzhi stong gis bcal ba na ni de las gzhan pa rnams yod do //
analyzed: de'i 'og na dpag tshad bzhi stong bzhi stong gis bcal ba na ni de las gzhan pa rnams yod do //
translated: The other hells are located at intervals of four thousand leagues.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos kyi gnas ji lta ba bzhin du grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba'i gnas dang po yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos kyi gnas ji lta ba bzhin du grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba'i gnas dang po yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The first cold hell is located at the same distance below Jambudvīpa as the Reviving Hell.

original: de'i 'og tu dpag tshad nyis stong nyis stong gis bcal @38b ba na ni de las gzhan pa rnams yod pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dpag tshad nyis stong nyis stong gis bcal @38b ba na ni de las gzhan pa rnams yod pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: The other cold hells are located at intervals of two thousand leagues.

original: yi dags kyi gnas gzhan dang / lha ma yin gyi gnas gzhan dang / dud 'gro ni lha dang mi dang lhan cig rgyu ba nyid yin pas /
analyzed: yi dags kyi gnas gzhan dang / lha ma yin gyi gnas gzhan dang / dud 'gro ni lha dang mi dang lhan cig rgyu ba nyid yin pas /

analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi gnas gzhan logs shig tu rnam par mi gzhag go //

analyzed: gling bzhi dang / gling phran brgyad ni snga ma bzhin no //

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnam pa drug la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnam pa drug la /

original: gnas gzhan bye brag can med do //

analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams kyi lus kyi tshad ni nges pa yin te /

original: de dag kyang rang gi khru tshad phyed dang bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang rang gi khru tshad phyed dang bzhi pa ste /

original: lus shin tu che'o //
analyzed: lus shin tu che'o //

original: shar gyi lus 'phags pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags pa ji lta ba bzhin du /

analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyang lus shin tu che'o //
translated: The bodies of the humans of Godaniya in the west and Kuru in the north are very large.

analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi tshad ni rgyang grags kyi bzhi cha gcig go //

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi tshad ni rgyang grags kyi bzhi cha gcig las lhag go //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi tshad ni rgyang grags kyi bzhi cha gcig las lhag go //

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi tshad ni rgyang grags phyed do //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi tshad ni rgyang grags phyed do //

original: 'thab bral ba rnams kyang rgyang grags phyed do //
analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams kyang rgyang grags phyed do //
translated: The measure of the Yāma gods is also one-half of a krośa.

original: de yan chad de las gzhan pa'i lha'i ris thams cad ni bzhi cha re re lhag par blta bar bya'o //🔽tshangs ris pa rnams kyi dpag tshad phyed do //

original: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad gcig go //🔽tshangs pa chen po rnams kyi ni dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad gcig go // tshangs pa chen po rnams kyi ni dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis so //
translated: The measure of the Brahmapurohita gods is one yojana.🔽The measure of the Mahabrahma gods is one and one-half yojanas.

original: 'od chung ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad gnyis so //
analyzed: 'od chung ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad gnyis so //
translated: The measure of the Paritt•abha gods is two yojanas.

original: de yan chad de'i lhag ma'i lha'i ris rnams kyi lus kyi tshad ni de'i nyis 'gyur nyis 'gyur du blta bar bya'o //🔽sprin med pa rnams kyi ni ma gtogs @39b te /
analyzed: de yan chad de'i lhag ma'i lha'i ris rnams kyi lus kyi tshad ni de'i nyis 'gyur nyis 'gyur du blta bar bya'o // sprin med pa rnams kyi ni ma gtogs @39b te /

original: de la ni dpag tshad gsum 'bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la ni dpag tshad gsum 'bri bar bya'o //

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po dag gi tshad ni nges pa med do //🔽gang gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i las shin tu drag po byas shing bsags pa de'i lus ni ches che bar 'grub par 'gyur la /🔽gzhan dag gi ni gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po dag gi tshad ni nges pa med do // gang gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i las shin tu drag po byas shing bsags pa de'i lus ni ches che bar 'grub par 'gyur la / gzhan dag gi ni gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: The dimensions of the hells are not fixed.🔽The bodies of the hell beings are very large: their life expectancy is also very long.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po dag gi ji lta ba bzhin du grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / nye 'khor gyi sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po dag gi ji lta ba bzhin du grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / nye 'khor gyi sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The bodies of the beings of the other realms of sentient beings are of different sizes.🔽The cold hells, the occasional hells, the animal realm, and the hungry ghost realm are not fixed in space.

analyzed: lha ma yin rnams kyi lus ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i chad bzhin rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //

original: gzugs med pa dag gi ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag gi ni /
translated: The gods of the realm of form

analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phyir tshad med do //
translated: are immeasurable in size, because they have no attachment to matter.

original: de la tshe'i tshad rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la tshe'i tshad rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin te /

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi ni zhag sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig gi tshul gyis tshe'i tshad nges pa med de //🔽res 'ga' ni tshe dpag tu med par 'gyur ro //🔽res 'ga' ni tshe lo brgyad khri par 'gyur ro //

original: res 'ga' ni tshe lo bcu pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //🔽shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni nges pa yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni tshe lo bcu pa'i bar du 'gyur ro // shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni nges pa yin te /

original: lo nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: lo nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
translated: The life span of humans of Videha in the east is fixed at two hundred and fifty years.

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni lo lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni lo lnga brgya'o //

analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni lo stong ngo //

original: mi rnams kyi lo lnga bcu gang yin pa de ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi lo lnga bcu gang yin pa de ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nyin zhag gcig go //

analyzed: de lta bu'i nyin zhag sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lor brtsis pa'i lha'i lo brgya thub bo //

original: mi rnams kyi lo brgya gang yin pa de ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi lo brgya gang yin pa de ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: One hundred human years is one day and night for the Trāyastriṃśa gods.

original: de lta bu'i nyin zhag sum cu la zla ba gcig ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i nyin zhag sum cu la zla ba gcig ste /
translated: Thirty of these days make one month.

original: snga ma bzhin du tshe lo stong thub bo //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du tshe lo stong thub bo //

original: de las gzhan pa'i lha'i ris gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi bar du /🔽lha de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni nyin zhag kyang de'i nyis 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i lha'i ris gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi bar du / lha de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni nyin zhag kyang de'i nyis 'gyur la /
translated: From this level up to the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods,

analyzed: tshe'i tshad kyang de'i nyis 'gyur ba yin no //

analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad rangs pa ni /
translated: The lifespan of the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings is

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos kyi nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos kyi nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: one day and night in the great hell of Saṃjīva.

original: de lta bu'i nyin zhag sum cu la @40a * //🔽zla ba gcig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i nyin zhag sum cu la @40a * // zla ba gcig go //

original: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /

analyzed: tshe'i tshad kyang sems can dmyal ba pa'i lo lnga brgya thub bo //
translated: The lifespan is five hundred years in the hells.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i tshe tshad kyis /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i tshe tshad kyis /

analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos su skyes pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad bsgre ba de bzhin du /
translated: is the lifespan of beings born in the great hell of Saṃjīva.

analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyis thig nag tu skyes pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad bsgre'o //

analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyis bsdus 'joms su skyes pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad bsgre'o //

analyzed: dga' ldan pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyis du 'bod du skyes pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad bsgre'o //

translated: The life expectancy of the beings of Kālasūtra is equal to the life expectancy of the Thirty-Three gods.🔽The life expectancy of the beings of Saṃghāta is equal to the life expectancy of the Yāma gods.

analyzed: rab tu tsha bar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa'i bskal pa phyed do //

original: mnar med pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa'i bskal pa gcig go //
analyzed: mnar med pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa'i bskal pa gcig go //
translated: The life expectancy of the beings of Avīci is equal to one minor aeon.

original: lha ma yin rnams kyi ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams kyi ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang 'dra'o //
translated: The life expectancy of the Asuras is equal to that of the Thirty-Three gods.

original: dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams kyi tsha'i tshad ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams kyi tsha'i tshad ni nges pa med do //
translated: The life expectancy of animals and hungry ghosts is not determined.

original: grang ba'i sems can dmyal bar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni sems can dmyal ba chen por skyes pa'i sems can rnams las phyi ma phyi ma phyed phyed zhugs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: grang ba'i sems can dmyal bar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni sems can dmyal ba chen por skyes pa'i sems can rnams las phyi ma phyi ma phyed phyed zhugs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The life-span of sentient beings born in the cold hells is twice the life-span of sentient beings born in the corresponding great hells.

original: nye 'khor gyi sems can dmyal ba dang / nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal bar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni nges pa med do //🔽tshangs ris ba'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu la bskal pa gcig tu bgrang ba'i bskal pa gcig go //

translated: The life-span of sentient beings born in the neighboring hells and in the occasional hells is not fixed.🔽The life-span of sentient beings born in the Brahmakayika gods is one antarakalpa, which is calculated as one kalpa.

original: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa bzhi bcu la bskal pa gcig tu bgrang ba'i bskal ba gcig go //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa bzhi bcu la bskal pa gcig tu bgrang ba'i bskal ba gcig go //
translated: The life-span of sentient beings born in the Brahmapurohita gods is forty antarakalpas, which is calculated as one kalpa.

original: tshangs chen pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa drug cu la bskal pa gcig tu bgrang ba'i bskal pa gcig go //🔽'od chung ba rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu la bskal bar bgrang ba'i bskal ba gnyis so //
analyzed: tshangs chen pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa drug cu la bskal pa gcig tu bgrang ba'i bskal pa gcig go // 'od chung ba rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu la bskal bar bgrang ba'i bskal ba gnyis so //
translated: The lifespan of the Mahabrahma gods is one eon, which is calculated as sixty intermediate eons.🔽The lifespan of the Parittabha gods is two eons, which is calculated as eighty intermediate eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of the other form realms is calculated as twice the previous lifespan.

original: de yan chad de las gzhan pa'i gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i ris rnams @40b kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu po de'i nyis 'gyur nyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yan chad de las gzhan pa'i gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i ris rnams @40b kyi tshe'i tshad ni bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu po de'i nyis 'gyur nyis 'gyur ro //
translated: The lifespan of the Anabhraka gods is calculated as three eons.🔽The lifespan of the Punyaprasava gods is calculated as four eons.🔽The lifespan of the Brhatphala gods is calculated as eight eons.

original: sprin med pa rnams ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: sprin med pa rnams ni ma gtogs te /
translated: The lifespan of the Avrha gods is calculated as sixteen eons.

original: de la ni bskal pa gsum dbri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la ni bskal pa gsum dbri bar bya'o //
translated: The lifespan of the Atapa gods is calculated as thirty-two eons.🔽The lifespan of the Sudrsa gods is calculated as sixty-four eons.🔽The lifespan of the Sudarsana gods is calculated as one hundred and twenty-five eons.🔽The lifespan of the Akanistha gods is calculated as two hundred and fifty eons.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bskal ba nyi khri'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bskal ba nyi khri'o //
translated: The lifespan of the beings born in the sphere of infinite space is twenty thousand eons.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bzhi khri'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bzhi khri'o //
translated: The lifespan of the beings born in the sphere of infinite consciousness is forty thousand eons.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched du skyes pa rnams kyi ni drug khri'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched du skyes pa rnams kyi ni drug khri'o //
translated: The life expectancy of those born in the sphere of nothingness is sixty thousand eons.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skyes pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa brgyad khri'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skyes pa rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa brgyad khri'o //
translated: The life expectancy of those born in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is eighty thousand eons.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa rnams la ni bar ma dor 'chi ba yod do //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa rnams la ni bar ma dor 'chi ba yod do //
translated: Except for the northern continent Kuru, there is death in the middle for other beings.

original: de la mi rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags rnams kyi lus ni ror gyur te 'dug go //
analyzed: de la mi rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags rnams kyi lus ni ror gyur te 'dug go //
translated: Among them, the bodies of humans, animals, and ghosts become corpses and remain.

original: lha rnams dang sems can dmyal ba pa rnams kyi ni rnam par shes pa dang mgo mnyam du mi snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha rnams dang sems can dmyal ba pa rnams kyi ni rnam par shes pa dang mgo mnyam du mi snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: For the gods and hell beings, the consciousness and the body disappear simultaneously.

original: lus ror gyur te 'dug pa med do //
analyzed: lus ror gyur te 'dug pa med do //
translated: There is no body that becomes a corpse and remains.

original: de la longs spyod dang yongs su spyod pa rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la longs spyod dang yongs su spyod pa rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the presentation of enjoyment and experience:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba dang / kha zas kyi longs spyod dang / 'khrig pa'i longs spyod do //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba dang / kha zas kyi longs spyod dang / 'khrig pa'i longs spyod do //
translated: The experience of pleasure and pain, the enjoyment of food, and the enjoyment of sex.

original: de la sems can dmyal ba dag na ni sems can rnams gnod pa'i sdug bsngal shas cher nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sems can dmyal ba dag na ni sems can rnams gnod pa'i sdug bsngal shas cher nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the hells, sentient beings experience the suffering of harm.

original: dud 'gro rnams gcig la gcig za ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yi dags rnams ni bkres shing skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mi rnams ni tshol khros nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / lha rnams ni 'chi 'pho ba dang / ltung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams gcig la gcig za ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yi dags rnams ni bkres shing skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mi rnams ni tshol khros nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / lha rnams ni 'chi 'pho ba dang / ltung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Animals experience the suffering of devouring each other, hungry ghosts experience the suffering of hunger and thirst, humans experience the suffering of searching for what is difficult to obtain, and gods experience the suffering of death and falling.

original: de la sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos na ni /
analyzed: de la sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos na ni /
translated: In the great hell of Saṃjīva,

original: gnod pa'i sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu shas cher nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /

original: de bas na sems can dmyal ba de padma ltar gas pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sems can dmyal ba de padma ltar gas pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that hell is called Great Split Open Like a Lotus.

original: nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba dag tu skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyis ni rang rang gi lus las rang rang gi las las byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'di lta bu dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba dag tu skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyis ni rang rang gi lus las rang rang gi las las byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'di lta bu dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The sentient beings born in the occasional hells experience the suffering that arises from their own individual karma.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows.

original: mdo las dpal ldan gyis dris pa ni /
analyzed: mdo las dpal ldan gyis dris pa ni /
translated: The Questions of Śrīgupta Sūtra

original: moong gal gyi bus rgyas par brjod pa bzhin te /
analyzed: moong gal gyi bus rgyas par brjod pa bzhin te /
translated: and the extensive explanation by Maudgalyāyana.

original: de bas na sems can dmyal ba de la /
analyzed: de bas na sems can dmyal ba de la /
translated: Therefore, in that hell,🔽

original: nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called a “limited hell.”

original: de la dud 'gro ni gcig la gcig gsod par byed de /
analyzed: de la dud 'gro ni gcig la gcig gsod par byed de /
translated: Animals kill each other,

original: gang mthu chung ba gsod par byed do //
analyzed: gang mthu chung ba gsod par byed do //
translated: the strong killing the weak.

original: gzhi des sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi des sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of this, they experience suffering.

original: rang dbang med par yang gsod pa dang / brdeg pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la lha dang mi rnams kyi yo byad du gyur pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rang dbang med par yang gsod pa dang / brdeg pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la lha dang mi rnams kyi yo byad du gyur pa yang yin te /
translated: They are powerless to avoid being killed, beaten, and harmed by gods and humans, who use them as tools.

original: gzhi des na sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi des na sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of this, they experience various kinds of suffering.

original: yi dags rnams ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yi dags rnams ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Hungry ghosts, in brief, are of three types:

original: zas dang skom la phyi rol gyi sgrib pa yod pa dang / zas dang skom la nang gi sgrib pa yod pa dang / zas dang skom la sgrib pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: zas dang skom la phyi rol gyi sgrib pa yod pa dang / zas dang skom la nang gi sgrib pa yod pa dang / zas dang skom la sgrib pa yod pa'o //
translated: those who have an external obstruction to food and drink, those who have an internal obstruction to food and drink, and those who have an obstruction to food and drink.

original: zas dang skom la phyi rol gyi sgrib pa yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas dang skom la phyi rol gyi sgrib pa yod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an external obstruction to food and drink?

original: sems can gang dag ser sna shas cher bsten pa'i phyir yi dags kyi gnas su skyes la /
analyzed: sems can gang dag ser sna shas cher bsten pa'i phyir yi dags kyi gnas su skyes la /
translated: Those sentient beings who are born in the realm of hungry ghosts due to their excessive stinginess

original: de dag kyang bkres shing skom pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de dag kyang bkres shing skom pa dang ldan pas /
translated: are tormented by hunger and thirst.

original: pags pa dang / sha dang khrag kun skams nas /
analyzed: pags pa dang / sha dang khrag kun skams nas /
translated: Their skin, flesh, and blood dry up,

original: sdong dum tshig pa lta bur 'dug la gdong skras khebs pa dang / bkres shing skom pa dang ldan pa'i bzhin dang / kha shin tu skams shing lces ldag pa dang / bzhin 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sdong dum tshig pa lta bur 'dug la gdong skras khebs pa dang / bkres shing skom pa dang ldan pa'i bzhin dang / kha shin tu skams shing lces ldag pa dang / bzhin 'gyur bas /
translated: and they are like burnt logs, with their faces covered with hair, their faces tormented by hunger and thirst, their mouths extremely dry and licking, their faces contorted.

original: chu mig dang / mtsho dang / mtshe'u rnams su de dang der kun tu rgyu bar byed de /
analyzed: chu mig dang / mtsho dang / mtshe'u rnams su de dang der kun tu rgyu bar byed de /
translated: They wander here and there to springs, lakes, and ponds.

original: de dag tu yang sems can lag na ral gri thogs pa dang / lag na mdung thogs pa dang / lag na mdung thung thogs pa gzhan dag gis chu mig dang / mtsho dang / mtshe'u de dag las phyir 'gog par byed la /
analyzed: de dag tu yang sems can lag na ral gri thogs pa dang / lag na mdung thogs pa dang / lag na mdung thung thogs pa gzhan dag gis chu mig dang / mtsho dang / mtshe'u de dag las phyir 'gog par byed la /
translated: But there, others with swords in their hands, others with spears in their hands, and others with javelins in their hands block them from the springs, lakes, and ponds.

original: chu de yang rnag dang khrag tu mthong ste /
analyzed: chu de yang rnag dang khrag tu mthong ste /
translated: And they see the water as pus and blood.

original: des na de dag bdag nyid kyang 'thung mi 'dod par 'dug @45a * //
analyzed: des na de dag bdag nyid kyang 'thung mi 'dod par 'dug @45a * //
translated: They themselves do not want to drink it.

original: ste; de lta bu de dag ni zas dang skom la phyi rol gyi sgrib pa yod pa'i yi dags rnams so //
analyzed: ste; de lta bu de dag ni zas dang skom la phyi rol gyi sgrib pa yod pa'i yi dags rnams so //
translated: These are the hungry ghosts with external hindrances to food and drink.

original: zas dang skom la nang gi sgrib pa yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas dang skom la nang gi sgrib pa yod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the hungry ghosts with internal hindrances to food and drink?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: kha khab tsam la /
analyzed: kha khab tsam la /
translated: Their mouths are like the eye of a needle,

original: kha 'bar ba can dang / lba ba can dang / gsus po che ste /
analyzed: kha 'bar ba can dang / lba ba can dang / gsus po che ste /
translated: while their bellies are like mountains, their mouths are ablaze, they have goiters, and their bellies are huge.

original: 'di ltar de dag gzhan dag gis bgegs ma byas par bdag nyid kyis zas dang skom nyid du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gzhan dag gis bgegs ma byas par bdag nyid kyis zas dang skom nyid du zin kyang /
translated: Even though they are not prevented by others from eating and drinking,

original: bza' ba dang btung bar mi nus pa de lta bu de dag ni zas dang skom la nang gi sgrib pa yod pa'i yi dags rnams so //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung bar mi nus pa de lta bu de dag ni zas dang skom la nang gi sgrib pa yod pa'i yi dags rnams so //
translated: they are unable to eat or drink. These are the hungry ghosts with internal hindrances to food and drink.

original: zas dang skom la sgrib pa yod pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas dang skom la sgrib pa yod pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the hungry ghosts with hindrances to food and drink?

original: yi dags me lce'i phreng ba can zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: yi dags me lce'i phreng ba can zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: There are hungry ghosts called “Garland of Flames.”

original: de dag gis zos so cog dang 'thungs so cog thams cad tshig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis zos so cog dang 'thungs so cog thams cad tshig par 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever they eat or drink burns them.

original: des na de dag gi bkres shing skom pa'i sdug bsngal ba rnams kyang med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de dag gi bkres shing skom pa'i sdug bsngal ba rnams kyang med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the suffering of hunger and thirst of those beings is not absent.

original: yi dags ljan ljin za ba zhes bya ba dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: yi dags ljan ljin za ba zhes bya ba dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are also hungry ghosts called “filth-eaters.”

original: de dag kha cig ni phyi sa za zhing gcin 'thung ste /🔽gang mi gtsang zhing mnam la dri nga ba dang / gnod pa dang / smad par bya ba de ni bza' ba 'am /
analyzed: de dag kha cig ni phyi sa za zhing gcin 'thung ste / gang mi gtsang zhing mnam la dri nga ba dang / gnod pa dang / smad par bya ba de ni bza' ba 'am /
translated: Some of them eat excrement and drink urine.

original: 'thungs bar nus so //
analyzed: 'thungs bar nus so //
translated: Whatever is impure, foul-smelling, disgusting, harmful, and contemptible, they are able to eat and drink that.

original: yang kha cig ni rang gi sha rnams kyang gcad de za la /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni rang gi sha rnams kyang gcad de za la /
translated: Some of them cut off their own flesh and eat it.

original: gtsang ba 'am bsod pa gang yin pa de ni bza' ba dang btung bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gtsang ba 'am bsod pa gang yin pa de ni bza' ba dang btung bar mi nus te /
translated: Whatever is pure and good, they are unable to eat and drink that.

original: de lta bu de dag ni /
analyzed: de lta bu de dag ni /
translated: Those are the hungry ghosts

original: zas dang skom la sgrib pa yod pa'i yi dags rnams so //
analyzed: zas dang skom la sgrib pa yod pa'i yi dags rnams so //
translated: who have an obstruction to food and drink.

original: de la mir skyes pa'i sems can rnams ni phongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'di lta bu myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la mir skyes pa'i sems can rnams ni phongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'di lta bu myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Among those, beings born as humans experience the suffering of poverty in this way.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i bkres shing skom pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pas phongs pa /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i bkres shing skom pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pas phongs pa /

analyzed: kha zas ngan pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'gro ba las byung ba dang / tshol khro dang / ngal ba la sogs pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dus tshigs 'gyur ba'i grang ba dang / tsha bas gnod par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang /

original: rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug @45b bsngal la'o //🔽'di ltar sems can dmyal ba dag na ni /
analyzed: rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug @45b bsngal la'o //🔽'di ltar sems can dmyal ba dag na ni /
translated: the suffering of being deprived of the pleasure of eating and drinking,🔽the suffering of being deprived of the pleasure

original: 'chi ba nyid la bde bar 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba nyid la bde bar 'dzin te /
translated: They hold death itself to be happiness.

original: de bas na de la ni sdug bsngal du rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na de la ni sdug bsngal du rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, it is not considered to be suffering.

original: lha rnams la ni gnad 'chad pa ni med la 'chi 'pho ba dang / ltung ba'i sdug bsngal ni yod de /
analyzed: lha rnams la ni gnad 'chad pa ni med la 'chi 'pho ba dang / ltung ba'i sdug bsngal ni yod de /
translated: Gods do not have the suffering of being cut up, but they do have the suffering of death, transmigration, and falling.

original: ji skad du lha'i bu 'chi 'pho ba na snga ltas rnam pa lnga 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji skad du lha'i bu 'chi 'pho ba na snga ltas rnam pa lnga 'byung ste /
translated: It is said that when a god is about to die and transmigrate, five signs appear:

original: gos dri ma med pa la dri ma can du 'gyur ba dang / me tog gi phreng ba sngon ma rnyings pa rnyings par 'gyur ba dang / mchan khung gnyis nas rdul 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / lus las dri mi zhim pa 'byung ba dang /🔽lha dang lha'i bu yang rung bdag nyid kyi stan la mi dga' bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gos dri ma med pa la dri ma can du 'gyur ba dang / me tog gi phreng ba sngon ma rnyings pa rnyings par 'gyur ba dang / mchan khung gnyis nas rdul 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / lus las dri mi zhim pa 'byung ba dang / lha dang lha'i bu yang rung bdag nyid kyi stan la mi dga' bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: his clean clothes become soiled, his flower garlands wither, sweat appears from his armpits, a foul odor arises from his body, and he no longer enjoys his seat.

original: de'i tshe 'khor gyi nang du 'dus pa na lha'i bu mo de dag de las gzhan pa'i lha'i bu dag dang lhan cig tu dga' mgur spyod pa de dag des mthong nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor gyi nang du 'dus pa na lha'i bu mo de dag de las gzhan pa'i lha'i bu dag dang lhan cig tu dga' mgur spyod pa de dag des mthong nas /
translated: When he gathers with his retinue, he sees the daughters of the gods enjoying themselves with other gods.

original: gzhi de las sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba chen po myong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhi de las sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba chen po myong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and on that basis, he will experience great suffering and mental pain.

original: de bzhin du spa gong bar gyur pa'i sdug bsngal yang myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du spa gong bar gyur pa'i sdug bsngal yang myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, he will experience the suffering of being humiliated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de la bsod nams kyi phung po ches rgya che ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de'i lha'i 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan ches che bar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la bsod nams kyi phung po ches rgya che ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de'i lha'i 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan ches che bar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because in that case, he will possess a vast accumulation of merit, and the divine objects of the five kinds of sense pleasures that he experiences will be far superior to those of the other gods.

original: der de las gzhan pa'i lha'i bu bsod nams ches chung ba rnams kyis mthong na spa gong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: der de las gzhan pa'i lha'i bu bsod nams ches chung ba rnams kyis mthong na spa gong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the other gods, whose merit is far less, see this, they will be humiliated.

original: gzhi de las kyang sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba chen po myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi de las kyang sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba chen po myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and on that basis, they will experience great suffering and mental pain.

original: de bzhin du gcad pa dang / dral ba dang / spyugs pa dang / gsad pa'i sdug bsngal yang myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gcad pa dang / dral ba dang / spyugs pa dang / gsad pa'i sdug bsngal yang myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, he will experience the suffering of being cut, gashed, banished, and killed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar lha rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams g-yul sprod pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams g-yul sprod pa na /
translated: Thus, when the gods and demigods fight,

original: lha rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / phan tshun du 'gras par 'gyur bas gser dang dngul dang shel dang / bee d'urya'i mtshon cha sna bzhi po dag blangs nas g-yul 'gyed de /
analyzed: lha rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / phan tshun du 'gras par 'gyur bas gser dang dngul dang shel dang / bee d'urya'i mtshon cha sna bzhi po dag blangs nas g-yul 'gyed de /
translated: the gods and demigods take up the four types of weapons of gold, silver, crystal, and beryl and fight.

original: de yang lha rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams kyi yan lag dang / nying lag 'chad pa yang yod /
analyzed: de yang lha rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams kyi yan lag dang / nying lag 'chad pa yang yod /
translated: Some of the gods and demigods are wounded in their major and minor body parts.

original: lus 'dral ba yang yod /
analyzed: lus 'dral ba yang yod /
translated: Some are split open.

original: gsod pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gsod pa yang yod do //
translated: Some are killed.

original: de dag gi yan lag dang nying lag chad pa rnams kyang phyir skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag gi yan lag dang nying lag chad pa rnams kyang phyir skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Their major and minor body parts that have been severed regenerate.

original: lus dral ba yang phyir 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dral ba yang phyir 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those whose bodies have been split open are revived.

original: gang gi tshe mgo gcad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro //🔽de la ched @46a * //🔽'ga' ni lha rnams pham par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mgo gcad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro // de la ched @46a * // 'ga' ni lha rnams pham par 'gyur /
translated: When their heads are cut off, they die.🔽Sometimes the gods are defeated.

original: ched 'ga' ni lha ma yin rnams pham par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni lha ma yin rnams pham par 'gyur te /
translated: Sometimes the demigods are defeated.

original: lha rnams mthu che ba'i phyir lan mang du lha rnams rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha rnams mthu che ba'i phyir lan mang du lha rnams rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the gods are more powerful, the gods often win.

original: de gnyis las gang dag pham par gyur pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de gnyis las gang dag pham par gyur pa de dag ni /
translated: When one of the two sides is defeated,

original: rang gi grong khyer du zhugs nas bde bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi grong khyer du zhugs nas bde bar 'gyur te /
translated: they return to their own city and are happy.

original: dar zhugs nas de dag gcig la gcig gis mi tshugs so //
analyzed: dar zhugs nas de dag gcig la gcig gis mi tshugs so //
translated: Once they have returned to their city, they cannot be harmed by the other.

original: de la lha rnams ni lha ma yin gyi bu mo dag gi phyir lha ma yin rnams dang 'gras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la lha rnams ni lha ma yin gyi bu mo dag gi phyir lha ma yin rnams dang 'gras par 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods fight with the asuras for the sake of the asura women.

original: lha ma yin rnams ni bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi'i phyir lha rnams dang 'gras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams ni bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi'i phyir lha rnams dang 'gras par 'gyur ro //
translated: The asuras fight with the gods for the sake of the four kinds of nectar.

original: lha ma yin rnams kyang lha'i 'gro bas bsdus pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams kyang lha'i 'gro bas bsdus pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The asuras should be regarded as belonging to the realm of the gods.

original: 'on kyang de dag ni sgyu can 'drid pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa sgyu dang g-yo'i shas che ba yin te /🔽de bas na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag ni sgyu can 'drid pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa sgyu dang g-yo'i shas che ba yin te / de bas na 'di lta ste /
translated: However, they are deceitful and deceptive, and they are full of deceit and guile.🔽Therefore, they are not vessels for the wholesome dharmas,

original: lha rnams bzhin du dkar po'i chos rnams kyi snod du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lha rnams bzhin du dkar po'i chos rnams kyi snod du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: as are the gods.

original: de'i phyir ched 'ga' mdo gzhan dag las 'gro ba tha dad pa'i bstan pas bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ched 'ga' mdo gzhan dag las 'gro ba tha dad pa'i bstan pas bstan to //
translated: Therefore, in some sūtras, the Buddha taught that they are different from the gods.

original: de dag ni lha nyid yin na /
analyzed: de dag ni lha nyid yin na /
translated: But they are not gods.

original: lha'i chos yang dag par blangs te gnas pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: lha'i chos yang dag par blangs te gnas pa ma yin pas /
translated: They do not observe the gods’ moral precepts.

original: de'i phyir lha ma yin rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lha ma yin rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called asuras.

original: lha'i bu ches mthu dang ldan pa ches 'khrugs par gyur na /
analyzed: lha'i bu ches mthu dang ldan pa ches 'khrugs par gyur na /
translated: When the gods are very powerful and very angry,

original: lha'i bu ches mthu chung bar rang gi gnas na spong zhing skrod par byed de /
analyzed: lha'i bu ches mthu chung bar rang gi gnas na spong zhing skrod par byed de /
translated: the asuras, who are less powerful, are expelled from their own abodes.

original: de bas na lha rnams kyi sdug bsngal gsum po 'chi 'pho ba dang / ltung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / spa gong ba'i sdug bsngal dang / gcad pa dang / dral ba dang / gsad pa dang / sbyugs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na lha rnams kyi sdug bsngal gsum po 'chi 'pho ba dang / ltung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / spa gong ba'i sdug bsngal dang / gcad pa dang / dral ba dang / gsad pa dang / sbyugs pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the gods experience three kinds of suffering: the suffering of death and falling; the suffering of being frightened; and the suffering of being cut, split, killed, and burned.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams la ni sdug bsngal de dag rnam pa thams cad du med do //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams la ni sdug bsngal de dag rnam pa thams cad du med do //
translated: But the beings in the form and formless realms do not experience any of these kinds of suffering.

original: 'di ltar sems can de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i snod du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i snod du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those sentient beings are not vessels for the feeling of pain.

original: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa dang ldan zhing sgrib pa dang bcas la /
analyzed: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa dang ldan zhing sgrib pa dang bcas la /
translated: However, they are afflicted, obscured,

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang / gnas pa la rang dbang med pa'i phyir de dag kyang gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal gyis ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang / gnas pa la rang dbang med pa'i phyir de dag kyang gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal gyis ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: and powerless over their death, transmigration, and rebirth, so they are painful due to the suffering of the negative reflex actions.

original: zag pa med pa'i khams na ni gnas ngan len gyis sdug bsngal thams cad yang dag par chad pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i khams na ni gnas ngan len gyis sdug bsngal thams cad yang dag par chad pa yin te /
translated: In the uncontaminated realm, all suffering due to negative reflex actions is completely severed.

original: de bsan de kho na yang dag bar bde ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bsan de kho na yang dag bar bde ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, that alone is true happiness.

original: gzhan thams cad ni sdug @46b bsngal ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni sdug @46b bsngal ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: All others should be understood as suffering.

original: de la sems can dmyal ba rnam pa bzhi char na yang bde ba myong ba med de /
analyzed: de la sems can dmyal ba rnam pa bzhi char na yang bde ba myong ba med de /
translated: In the four types of hells, there is no experience of happiness.

original: sems can dmyal ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du yi dags rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du yi dags rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Like the hells, the hungry ghosts are also like that.

original: yi dags rdzu 'phrul chen po rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / mi rnams la ni phyi rol du bltas pa las byung ba'i yo byad kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba 'dres pas 'dren mar snang ngo //
analyzed: yi dags rdzu 'phrul chen po rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / mi rnams la ni phyi rol du bltas pa las byung ba'i yo byad kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba 'dres pas 'dren mar snang ngo //
translated: The gods, the demigods, the ghosts with great magical powers, the animals, and humans experience a mixture of pleasure and pain arising from external objects.

original: de la mi rnams kyi nang na 'khor los sgyur ba'i bde ba ni mchog dang / gtso bo dang gya nom pa'i yin no //
analyzed: de la mi rnams kyi nang na 'khor los sgyur ba'i bde ba ni mchog dang / gtso bo dang gya nom pa'i yin no //
translated: Among humans, the happiness of the universal monarch is the most excellent, the most sublime, and the most refined.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba 'jig rten du 'byung ba na rin po che sna bdun dang ldan par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba 'jig rten du 'byung ba na rin po che sna bdun dang ldan par 'byung ste /
translated: When a universal monarch appears in the world, he possesses seven treasures.

original: de'i rin po che sna bdun po de dag ni 'di lta bu yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i rin po che sna bdun po de dag ni 'di lta bu yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: These are the seven treasures:

original: 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / nor bu rin po che dang / bud med rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang / bdun pa blon po rin po che'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / nor bu rin po che dang / bud med rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang / bdun pa blon po rin po che'o //
translated: the precious wheel, the precious elephant, the precious horse, the precious wife, the precious jewel, the precious steward, and the precious minister.

original: de'i tshe de'i 'khor lo rin po che ji lta bu zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i 'khor lo rin po che ji lta bu zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What kind of precious wheel will appear?

original: rin po che sna bdun po dag 'byung ba ni mdo 'di nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun po dag 'byung ba ni mdo 'di nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The appearance of the seven precious things should be explained according to the sutras.

original: de la gling bzhi pa la ni khams kyi rgyal po rnams rang phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gling bzhi pa la ni khams kyi rgyal po rnams rang phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the four continents, the wheel-turning kings are worshipped by the kings of the regions.

original: 'di dag ni lha'i 'bangs lags kyi lhas 'di dag la legs par rjes su bstan du gsol /
analyzed: 'di dag ni lha'i 'bangs lags kyi lhas 'di dag la legs par rjes su bstan du gsol /
translated: They say: “These are the subjects of the gods. May the gods instruct them well.

original: bdag cag ni lha'i rjes su mchi ba lags so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bdag cag ni lha'i rjes su mchi ba lags so zhes zer ro //
translated: We are the followers of the gods.”

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos /
translated: The wheel-turning kings

original: de dag la bsgo ba gtso bo dag de'i phyir khyed bdag cag gis rang rang gi ris su gtogs pa rnams chos kyis legs par rjes su ston cig / chos ma yin pas ni ma byed cig / khyed kyis chos ma yin pa spyod pa dang /
analyzed: de dag la bsgo ba gtso bo dag de'i phyir khyed bdag cag gis rang rang gi ris su gtogs pa rnams chos kyis legs par rjes su ston cig / chos ma yin pas ni ma byed cig / khyed kyis chos ma yin pa spyod pa dang /
translated: tell them: “Chiefs, therefore you must instruct well those in your own class according to the Dharma and not by non-Dharma.

original: log par spyod pa rnams kyang yul 'khor du 'dug tu ma gzhug shig ces bsgo bar byed do //
analyzed: log par spyod pa rnams kyang yul 'khor du 'dug tu ma gzhug shig ces bsgo bar byed do //
translated: He also orders that those who have misbehaved should not remain in the country.

original: gling gsum pa la ni bo nya btang bas phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gling gsum pa la ni bo nya btang bas phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the third continent, the king sends an envoy to demand submission.

original: gling gnyis pa la ni rang reng byed de brtsal bas phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gling gnyis pa la ni rang reng byed de brtsal bas phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the second continent, the king himself goes to demand submission.

original: gling gcig pa la ni /
analyzed: gling gcig pa la ni /
translated: In the case of the first continent,

original: mtshon cha kun tu 'khrug pa'i bar du byas pas phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshon cha kun tu 'khrug pa'i bar du byas pas phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he goes to war until he has gained submission.

original: lha rnams ni mtho ris kyi rnam par 'byor ba chen po myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha rnams ni mtho ris kyi rnam par 'byor ba chen po myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The gods experience the great prosperity of the heavens.

original: kha dog dang ldan zhing dga' ba'i shas che la /
analyzed: kha dog dang ldan zhing dga' ba'i shas che la /
translated: They are endowed with beauty and have a great deal of pleasure.

original: rang rang gi gzhal med khang dag na yun ring por gnas so //
analyzed: rang rang gi gzhal med khang dag na yun ring por gnas so //
translated: They live for a long time in their own celestial palaces.

original: de dag ni lus kyi phyi nang gtsang zhing /🔽dring @47a * //🔽ba med do //
analyzed: de dag ni lus kyi phyi nang gtsang zhing / dring @47a * // ba med do //
translated: Their bodies are clean inside and out.🔽They have no bad smells.

original: de dag la ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They do not have, for example,

original: mi rnams kyi mi gtsang ba'i rdzas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi mi gtsang ba'i rdzas 'di lta ste /
translated: the impure substances that humans have, such as

original: rdul dang / dri ma dang / rus pa dang / rgyus pa dang / rtsa dang / mkhal ma dang / snying la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag med do //
analyzed: rdul dang / dri ma dang / rus pa dang / rgyus pa dang / rtsa dang / mkhal ma dang / snying la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag med do //
translated: There are no bones, sinews, channels, kidneys, heart, and so on.

original: de dag gi gzhal med khang yang gser las grub pa dang / dngul las grub pa dang / shel las grub pa dang / bee d'urya las grub pa rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhal med khang yang gser las grub pa dang / dngul las grub pa dang / shel las grub pa dang / bee d'urya las grub pa rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: Their celestial mansions are of four types: made of gold, silver, crystal, and beryl.

original: tha dad par phye zhing rnam par bkra ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa nyams dga' ba dag dang / ba gam nyams dga' ba dang / bsil khang nyams dga' ba dag dang / stegs bu nyams dga' ba dag dang / skar khung dra ba can nyams dga' ba dag dang /
analyzed: tha dad par phye zhing rnam par bkra ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa nyams dga' ba dag dang / ba gam nyams dga' ba dang / bsil khang nyams dga' ba dag dang / stegs bu nyams dga' ba dag dang / skar khung dra ba can nyams dga' ba dag dang /
translated: They are delightful with their various towers, delightful with their various turrets, delightful with their various pavilions, delightful with their various balconies, delightful with their various latticed windows,

original: nor bu'i tshogs kyis spras shing snang ba kun tu 'gyed pa kun nas mdzes pa dag yod do //
analyzed: nor bu'i tshogs kyis spras shing snang ba kun tu 'gyed pa kun nas mdzes pa dag yod do //
translated: and delightful with their various jewel ornaments that shine with a brilliant light.

original: de bzhin du bza' ba 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bza' ba 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod do //
translated: There are also wish-fulfilling trees that provide food.

original: de dag las bdud rtsi'i kha zas rnam pa bzhi po sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las bdud rtsi'i kha zas rnam pa bzhi po sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From them come the four kinds of nectar-food: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: de bzhin du btung ba 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du btung ba 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de /
translated: There are wish-fulfilling trees that produce drinks.

original: de dag las sbrang rtsi dang / sbrang chang dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las sbrang rtsi dang / sbrang chang dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From them come honey and mead.

original: bzhon pa 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de /
analyzed: bzhon pa 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de /
translated: There are wish-fulfilling trees that produce vehicles.

original: de dag las bzhon pa rnam pa sna tshogs shing rta dang / khyogs dang khyogs g-yogs pa la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag las bzhon pa rnam pa sna tshogs shing rta dang / khyogs dang khyogs g-yogs pa la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From them come various vehicles: chariots, palanquins, and so on.

original: gos 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de /🔽de dag las gos rnam pa sna tshogs phra bdar che zhing /
analyzed: gos 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de / de dag las gos rnam pa sna tshogs phra bdar che zhing /
translated: There are wish-fulfilling trees that produce clothes.🔽From them come various kinds of clothes, fine and smooth,

original: shin tu dkar ba dang / kha dog rnam pa sna tshogs dang / gser gyis spras pa rnam par bkra ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu dkar ba dang / kha dog rnam pa sna tshogs dang / gser gyis spras pa rnam par bkra ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: very white, of various colors, and variegated with gold.

original: rgyan 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod do /
analyzed: rgyan 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod do /
translated: There are wish-fulfilling trees that produce ornaments.

original: de dag las nor bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / rna cha gdub 'khor dang / mgul gdub dang / gdu bu dang / lag pa'i rgyan dang / rkang pa'i rgyan rnams dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i rgyan nor bu sna tshogs kyis spras pa dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag las nor bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / rna cha gdub 'khor dang / mgul gdub dang / gdu bu dang / lag pa'i rgyan dang / rkang pa'i rgyan rnams dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i rgyan nor bu sna tshogs kyis spras pa dag 'byung ngo //
translated: From them come forth jewels, armlets, earrings, necklaces, bracelets, anklets, and other ornaments, and various other precious objects.

original: spos dang / bdug pa dang / me tog phreng 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de /
analyzed: spos dang / bdug pa dang / me tog phreng 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de /
translated: There are trees that produce perfumes, incense, and flower garlands.

original: de dag las spos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / bdug pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / me tog phreng ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag las spos rnam pa sna tshogs dang / bdug pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / me tog phreng ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From them come forth various perfumes, various incenses, and various flower garlands.

original: de dag gi nang na shing yongs 'du sa brtol zhes bya ba mchog dang / gtso bo dang / @47b rab dang / gya nom pa zhig yod de /🔽de'i rtsa ba ni dpag tshad lnga bcu thur du zug go //
analyzed: de dag gi nang na shing yongs 'du sa brtol zhes bya ba mchog dang / gtso bo dang / @47b rab dang / gya nom pa zhig yod de / de'i rtsa ba ni dpag tshad lnga bcu thur du zug go //
translated: Among them is a tree called Pārijāta, the best, the chief, the most excellent, the most exquisite.

original: 'phad du ni dpag tshad brgya yod de /
analyzed: 'phad du ni dpag tshad brgya yod de /
translated: Its roots go down fifty leagues and its branches spread out over fifty leagues.🔽It is a hundred leagues high.

original: yal ga dang / lo ma dang / lo ma gzhon nu ni dpag tshad brgyad cur khyab par 'dug go //
analyzed: yal ga dang / lo ma dang / lo ma gzhon nu ni dpag tshad brgyad cur khyab par 'dug go //
translated: The branches, leaves, and young leaves spread out for eighty leagues.

original: de'i me tog thams cad yongs su rgyas pa'i dri yang rdzi phyogs su ni dpag tshad brgyar ngad ldang ngo //
analyzed: de'i me tog thams cad yongs su rgyas pa'i dri yang rdzi phyogs su ni dpag tshad brgyar ngad ldang ngo //
translated: The fragrance of its fully blossomed flowers spreads for a hundred leagues with the wind,

original: ldog na ni dpag tshad lnga bcur ngad ldang ste /
analyzed: ldog na ni dpag tshad lnga bcur ngad ldang ste /
translated: and for fifty leagues against the wind.

original: de'i drung du sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / dbyar zla ba bzhi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po de dag gis rtse zhing dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i drung du sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / dbyar zla ba bzhi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po de dag gis rtse zhing dga' bar byed do //
translated: The gods of Trāyastriṃśa enjoy the five sense objects with the four months of summer in its presence.

original: de bzhin du bzhad gad dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzhad gad dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de /
translated: There are also wish-fulfilling trees that produce laughter, dance, song, and music.

original: de dag las bzhad gad dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra rnams kyi cha byad rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag las bzhad gad dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo'i sgra rnams kyi cha byad rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
translated: Various forms of laughter, dance, song, and music emerge from them.

original: de bzhin du snod spyad kyi yo byad 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du snod spyad kyi yo byad 'byung ba'i shing ljon pa dag yod de /
translated: There are also wish-fulfilling trees that produce utensils.

original: de dag las snod spyad kyi yo byad rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag las snod spyad kyi yo byad rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: From them, various utensils appear, such as:

original: kha zas kyi snod spyad kyi yo byad dang / skom gyi snod spyad kyi yo byad dang / mal cha dang / stan gyi yo byad dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i snod spyad kyi yo byad rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha zas kyi snod spyad kyi yo byad dang / skom gyi snod spyad kyi yo byad dang / mal cha dang / stan gyi yo byad dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i snod spyad kyi yo byad rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: utensils for food, utensils for drink, utensils for bedding and seats, and so on.

original: de dag ci 'dod pa dang / las ji lta ba bzhin du longs spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyi lag tu yo byad de dag 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ci 'dod pa dang / las ji lta ba bzhin du longs spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyi lag tu yo byad de dag 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever they desire, whatever they wish to enjoy according to their karma, those utensils will appear in their hands.

original: lha ma yin rnams kyi gzhal med khang dang / rnam par 'byor pa dang / bde ba dang / longs spyod pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams kyi gzhal med khang dang / rnam par 'byor pa dang / bde ba dang / longs spyod pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The palaces, enjoyments, and pleasures of the demigods should be understood in the same way.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan dag na ni shing ljon pa de lta bu dag la dpag bsam shing rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan dag na ni shing ljon pa de lta bu dag la dpag bsam shing rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: In Uttarakuru, those trees are called wish-fulfilling trees.

original: de dag shing de las rang gis len gyi bsams pas lag tu 'ong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag shing de las rang gis len gyi bsams pas lag tu 'ong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They think, “I will take it from the tree,” but it does not come into their hands.

original: de na ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a lu yang yod de /🔽sems can de dag ni bdag gir 'dzin pa yang med cing /
analyzed: de na ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a lu yang yod de / sems can de dag ni bdag gir 'dzin pa yang med cing /
translated: There is also unplanted, unharvested rice there.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa yang med la /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa yang med la /
translated: Those beings have no sense of ownership and no possessiveness.

original: khyad par du 'gro bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro bar nges pa yin no //
translated: They are certain to progress.

original: de la lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi khang bzangs rnam par rgyal byed ces bya ba /
analyzed: de la lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi khang bzangs rnam par rgyal byed ces bya ba /
translated: There is a palace of Śakra, lord of the gods, called Vaijayanta,

original: thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa zhig yod de /🔽de la ba gam brgya rtsa gcig yod do //
analyzed: thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa zhig yod de / de la ba gam brgya rtsa gcig yod do //
translated: which is the best of all.🔽It has one hundred and one balconies.

original: ba gam re re la yang khang pa brtsegs pa brgya brgya yod do //
analyzed: ba gam re re la yang khang pa brtsegs pa brgya brgya yod do //
translated: Each balcony has one hundred towers.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa re re la yang khang mig bdun bdun yod do //
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa re re la yang khang mig bdun bdun yod do //
translated: Each tower has seven rooms.

original: khang mig re re la yang lha'i bu mo bdun bdun @48a * //
analyzed: khang mig re re la yang lha'i bu mo bdun bdun @48a * //
translated: Each room has seven divine maidens,

original: yod do // lha'i bu mo re re la yang g-yog mo bdun bdun yod do //
analyzed: yod do // lha'i bu mo re re la yang g-yog mo bdun bdun yod do //
translated: and each divine maiden has seven servant girls.

original: lha rnams kyi sa gzhi thams cad kyang lag mthil bzhin du mnyam la mthon dman med cing reg na bde ba ste /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi sa gzhi thams cad kyang lag mthil bzhin du mnyam la mthon dman med cing reg na bde ba ste /
translated: The ground of the gods is even like the palm of a hand, without high and low, and pleasant to the touch.

original: rkang pa bzhag na ni ne ma zhes byed /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhag na ni ne ma zhes byed /
translated: When the foot is placed down, it sinks in,
