original: gnas dang de bzhin dngos po dang // tshol ba dang ni longs spyod dang // bsgrub pa dang ni byang chub gnyis //
analyzed: gnas dang de bzhin dngos po dang // tshol ba dang ni longs spyod dang // bsgrub pa dang ni byang chub gnyis //
translated: the accomplishment, and the two enlightenments,

original: de bzhin pha rol phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin pha rol phyin pa'o //
translated: and likewise the perfections.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi gnas gang zhe na /🔽gnas rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi gnas gang zhe na / gnas rnam pa drug ste /
translated: What is the basis of the investigation and analysis of one who is endowed with proper mental attention?🔽There are six kinds of bases:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: the basis of the entity,🔽the basis of the search,🔽the basis of enjoyment,🔽the basis of accomplishment,🔽the basis of the two enlightenments,🔽and the basis of the perfections.

original: nges pa'i dus dang / ldog pa'i dus dang / las kyi dus dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: nges pa'i dus dang / ldog pa'i dus dang / las kyi dus dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dus so //
translated: the time of certainty, the time of reversal, the time of action, the time of freedom from worldly attachment, the time of freedom from transworldly attachment, and the time of benefiting sentient beings.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the investigation and analysis of one who is endowed with proper mental attention?

original: dngos po brgyad de /
analyzed: dngos po brgyad de /
translated: It is eightfold:

original: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa pa las byung ba dang / thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de las gzhan pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa pa las byung ba dang / thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de las gzhan pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba dang /
translated: the object of meritorious work born of giving, the object of meritorious work born of morality, the object of meritorious work born of meditation, the object of meritorious work born of learning, the object of meritorious work born of reflection, the object of meritorious work born of meditation other than that,

original: so sor brtags pa las byung ba dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa las byung ba dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa las byung ba'o //
translated: the object of meritorious work born of investigation, and the object of meritorious work born of benefiting sentient beings.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi tshol ba gang zhe na /🔽'di ltar 'di na kha cig / chos kyi bab chol ma yin par longs spyod tshol gyi /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams kyi tshol ba gang zhe na / 'di ltar 'di na kha cig / chos kyi bab chol ma yin par longs spyod tshol gyi /
translated: What is the search of those who are endowed with proper mental attention and who are endowed with investigation and analysis?

original: chos ma yin pas bab chol du ma yin no //
analyzed: chos ma yin pas bab chol du ma yin no //
translated: Here someone seeks wealth in a way that is in accordance with the Dharma, not in a way that is contrary to the Dharma.

original: longs spyod gang zhe na /🔽'di ltar longs spyod de nyid de ltar btsal nas chags pa med par longs spyod cing /🔽zhen pa med pa dang / chums pa med pa dang / mdud pa bor ba med pa dang / brgyal ba med pa dang / lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pa med pa dang / nyes dmigs su lta ba dang /
analyzed: longs spyod gang zhe na / 'di ltar longs spyod de nyid de ltar btsal nas chags pa med par longs spyod cing / zhen pa med pa dang / chums pa med pa dang / mdud pa bor ba med pa dang / brgyal ba med pa dang / lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pa med pa dang / nyes dmigs su lta ba dang /
translated: What is wealth?

original: nges par 'byung ba shes bzhin du longs spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba shes bzhin du longs spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: Having sought wealth in this way, one enjoys it without attachment, without clinging, without being tied to it, without being infatuated with it, without excessive greed for it, without excessive greed having arisen with regard to it, seeing the danger in it, and understanding deliverance.

original: yang @59b dag par bsgrub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang @59b dag par bsgrub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is right practice?

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi gtso bo la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi gtso bo la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba byed pa dang /
translated: In this world, some people respect their mothers, respect their fathers, respect ascetics, respect brahmins, serve the head of the clan, do what is beneficial, do what is meritorious,

original: 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten  rol tu kha na mtho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang / dus khrims la gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten  rol tu kha na mtho ba rnams la 'jigs par lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang / dus khrims la gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te gnas pa'o //
translated: fear the evil in this world and the next, give gifts, make merit, observe the Uposadha, and take up the precepts.

original: nyan thos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba ni nyan thos kyis las rgyas par bshad par bya'o //🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi tshogs la sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba ni nyan thos kyis las rgyas par bshad par bya'o // rang sangs rgyas kyi tshogs la sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application to the accumulation of the śrāvaka is explained in detail in the chapter on the śrāvaka.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis las rgyas bar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis las rgyas bar bshad par bya'o //
translated: The application to the accumulation of the pratyekabuddha is explained in detail in the chapter on the pratyekabuddha.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa la sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa la sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application to accomplishing the perfections is explained in detail in the chapter on the perfections.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained extensively in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: yang sbyin bdag gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang sbyin bdag gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, the characteristics of a donor are fourfold:

original: 'dod pa dang / phyogs mi 'dzin pa dang / phongs pa sel ba dang / yang dag par shes pa'o //🔽tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / phyogs mi 'dzin pa dang / phongs pa sel ba dang / yang dag par shes pa'o // tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: he gives what is desired, he is impartial, he dispels the despair of the poor, and he is well-informed.

original: rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The characteristics of one who is morally disciplined are fourfold:

original: 'dod pa dang chu lon gyis glon pa dang / kun tu mi spyod pa dang / yang dag par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang chu lon gyis glon pa dang / kun tu mi spyod pa dang / yang dag par shes pa'o //
translated: he gives what is desired, he is a bridge and a boat, he is not immoral, and he is well-informed.

original: sgom pa po'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sgom pa po'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The characteristics of a meditator are fourfold:

original: bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / nye bar sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang / mos pas snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par dag pa dang / shes pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / nye bar sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang / mos pas snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par dag pa dang / shes pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: his intention is pure, his application is pure, his meditative concentration through devotion is pure, and his knowledge is pure.

original: zas sbyin pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: zas sbyin pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The giving of food is sixfold:

original: yi dam can la sbyin pa dang / kun tu 'tshol zas sbyin pa dang / gnod pa la zas sbyin pa dang / rang bzhin gyis phongs pa la zas sbyin pa dang / yul dang bral bar gnas pa la zas sbyin pa dang / yongs su zhen pa la zas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: yi dam can la sbyin pa dang / kun tu 'tshol zas sbyin pa dang / gnod pa la zas sbyin pa dang / rang bzhin gyis phongs pa la zas sbyin pa dang / yul dang bral bar gnas pa la zas sbyin pa dang / yongs su zhen pa la zas sbyin pa'o //
translated: giving to those who are devoted to the tutelary deities, giving to those who are seeking, giving to those who are suffering, giving to those who are naturally poor, giving to those who are in a bad environment, and giving to those who are addicted.

original: gnod pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: gnod pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Suffering is of eight kinds:

original: bkres pas gnod pa dang / skom pas gnod pa dang / kha zas ngan pa za bas gnod pa dang / yongs su ngal bas gnod pa dang / grang bas gnod pa dang / tsha bas gnod pa dang / skyabs med pas gnod pa dang /🔽bsgribs pas gnod pa'o //
analyzed: bkres pas gnod pa dang / skom pas gnod pa dang / kha zas ngan pa za bas gnod pa dang / yongs su ngal bas gnod pa dang / grang bas gnod pa dang / tsha bas gnod pa dang / skyabs med pas gnod pa dang / bsgribs pas gnod pa'o //
translated: suffering from hunger, suffering from thirst, suffering from eating bad food, suffering from fatigue, suffering from cold, suffering from heat, suffering from having no shelter, and suffering from being obscured.

original: yang gnod pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: yang gnod pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Suffering is also of six kinds:

original: lhan cig skyes pa dang / 'dod pas phongs pa las byung ba dang / @60a * //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dang / 'dod pas phongs pa las byung ba dang / @60a * //
translated: innate, arising from the loss of desired things, arising from the meeting of conditions, arising from the separation from what is desired, arising from not obtaining what is desired, and arising from the five aggregates of the round of birth and death.

original: 'gro ba las byung ba dang / dus tshigs 'gyur ba las byung ba dang / 'dzag gnod byed pa las byung ba dang / tha snyad chad pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba las byung ba dang / dus tshigs 'gyur ba las byung ba dang / 'dzag gnod byed pa las byung ba dang / tha snyad chad pa las byung ba'o //
translated: from going, from the change of seasons, from the harm of falling, and from the loss of social position.

original: phan gdags pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: phan gdags pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Benefiting is sixfold:

original: nye bar rton pas phan gdags pa dang / 'gro bas gnod pa la phan gdags pa dang / g-yogs pas phan gdags pa dang / spos dang me tog phreng dang byug pas phan gdags pa dang / gnas kyis phan gdags pa dang / 'grogs pa la phan gdags pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar rton pas phan gdags pa dang / 'gro bas gnod pa la phan gdags pa dang / g-yogs pas phan gdags pa dang / spos dang me tog phreng dang byug pas phan gdags pa dang / gnas kyis phan gdags pa dang / 'grogs pa la phan gdags pa'o //
translated: benefiting by support, benefiting by going, benefiting by covering, benefiting by incense, garlands, and ointments, benefiting by dwelling, and benefiting by companionship.

original: mi mdza' ba'i mtshan nyid ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi mdza' ba'i mtshan nyid ni bzhi ste /
translated: The characteristics of an enemy are four:

original: 'khrug pa'i bsam pa mi gtong ba dang / sdug pa la rnam par bgegs byed pa'i gnas dang / mi sdug pa bsgrub pa dang / phan pa ma yin pa bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i bsam pa mi gtong ba dang / sdug pa la rnam par bgegs byed pa'i gnas dang / mi sdug pa bsgrub pa dang / phan pa ma yin pa bsgrub pa'o //
translated: not giving up the intention to quarrel, being a basis for obstructing what is agreeable, being a basis for accomplishing what is disagreeable, and being a basis for accomplishing what is harmful.

original: de dag nyid las bzlog pa ni mdza' bo'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid las bzlog pa ni mdza' bo'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of a friend should be understood as the opposite of those.

original: bsgrub pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of practice:

original: yo byad kyi bde ba bsgrub pa dang / dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa dang // dga' ba med pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad kyi bde ba bsgrub pa dang / dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa dang // dga' ba med pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa'o //
translated: practice of the happiness of material things, practice of the happiness of joy, and practice of the happiness of freedom from joy.🔽These four are the teachings of the wise.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni mkhas pas bstan pa yin zhes bya ba mdo 'di'i rnam par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni mkhas pas bstan pa yin zhes bya ba mdo 'di'i rnam par bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of this sutra is as follows:

original: yang mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba ni bzhi po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: yang mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba ni bzhi po 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are four kinds of agreement to engage in what is suitable:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: 'gron la mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba dang / skye bo yongs la mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba dang / bla ma rnams dang mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba dang / tshogs par 'du 'os la mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba ste /
analyzed: 'gron la mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba dang / skye bo yongs la mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba dang / bla ma rnams dang mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba dang / tshogs par 'du 'os la mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba ste /
translated: agreement to engage in what is suitable for guests, agreement to engage in what is suitable for the general populace, agreement to engage in what is suitable for superiors, and agreement to engage in what is suitable for those who are worthy of being in an assembly.

original: mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba bzhi po 'di dag la /
analyzed: mthun par 'jug par khas blang ba bzhi po 'di dag la /
translated: In these four kinds of agreement to engage in what is suitable,

original: gnas bzhi bsten nas 'bras bu ldar 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas bzhi bsten nas 'bras bu ldar 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: one should know that there are four bases that lead to the fruit of a stream-enterer.

original: 'di lta ste phan gdags pa dang / rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa dang / mchod pa dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / mthun par 'jug par gnas bzhi po 'di dag bsten nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste phan gdags pa dang / rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa dang / mchod pa dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / mthun par 'jug par gnas bzhi po 'di dag bsten nas /
translated: These four are: 1) being helpful, 2) not being harmful, 3) being respectful, and 4) being consistent.

original: longs sbyod che ba dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su grags pa dan yongs su nyon mongs pa med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: longs sbyod che ba dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su grags pa dan yongs su nyon mongs pa med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba ste /
translated: These four qualities lead to five results: 1) great wealth, 2) a good reputation in all directions, 3) freedom from vexation, 4) attainment of nirvana, and 5) rebirth in the higher realms.

original: 'bras bu lnga po 'di dag 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽mkhas pa rnams kyi mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu lnga po 'di dag 'grub par 'gyur ro // mkhas pa rnams kyi mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: These are the five results.

original: gsum po @60b 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: gsum po @60b 'di dag yin te /
translated: The wise have three characteristics:

original: dge ba yang dag par len pa dang / dge ba la gcig tu nges pa dang / dge ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba yang dag par len pa dang / dge ba la gcig tu nges pa dang / dge ba la brten pa'o //
translated: 1) they take up virtue, 2) they are certain in virtue, and 3) they rely on virtue.

original: gzhan yang gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsum ste /
translated: They also have three other characteristics:

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dang / lhag pa 'i sems yang dag par len pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab yang dag par len pa'o /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dang / lhag pa 'i sems yang dag par len pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab yang dag par len pa'o /
translated: 1) they take up the precepts of ethical discipline, 2) they take up the precepts of wisdom, and 3) they take up the precepts of the mind of awakening.

original: // / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: // / bam po drug pa /
translated: Chapter 6🔽

original: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the presentation of the imputation of incorrect mental activity?

original: de la sdom ni /
analyzed: de la sdom ni /
translated: The summary is:🔽The result is manifest in the cause, the existence of the past and future,🔽the self, permanence, karma,🔽Īśvara, and so on, the rejection of an end and no end,🔽causelessness, annihilation, nonexistence,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu mngon gsal dang // 'das dang ma 'ongs yod pa dang // bdag dang rtag dang las rnams dang // dbang phyug la sogs rnams 'tshe dang // mtha' dang mtha' med spong ba dang // rgyu med chad dang med pa dang // mchog dang dag pa bkra shis pa //🔽pha rol smra ba bcu drug yin //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu mngon gsal dang // 'das dang ma 'ongs yod pa dang // bdag dang rtag dang las rnams dang // dbang phyug la sogs rnams 'tshe dang // mtha' dang mtha' med spong ba dang // rgyu med chad dang med pa dang // mchog dang dag pa bkra shis pa // pha rol smra ba bcu drug yin //
translated: the supreme, purity, and auspiciousness🔽are the sixteen opponent positions.

original: pha rol smra ba ni bcu drug po 'di dag yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: pha rol smra ba ni bcu drug po 'di dag yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are sixteen opponent positions:🔽The result is manifest in the cause,🔽the existence of the past and future,🔽the self, permanence, karma,🔽Īśvara, and so on, the rejection of an end and no end,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod par smra ba dang / mngon par gsal bar smra ba dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod par smra ba dang / bdag tu smra ba dang / rtag par smra ba dang / sngon byas pa rgyur smra ba dang /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod par smra ba dang / mngon par gsal bar smra ba dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod par smra ba dang / bdag tu smra ba dang / rtag par smra ba dang / sngon byas pa rgyur smra ba dang /
translated: causelessness, annihilation, nonexistence,🔽the supreme, purity, and auspiciousness🔽are the sixteen opponent positions.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa por smra ba dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i chos su smra ba dang / mtha' dang mtha' med par smra ba dang / mtha' mi spong bar smra ba dang / rgyu med par smra ba dang / chad par smra ba dang /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa por smra ba dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i chos su smra ba dang / mtha' dang mtha' med par smra ba dang / mtha' mi spong bar smra ba dang / rgyu med par smra ba dang / chad par smra ba dang /
translated: Those who propound a creator such as Īśvara, those who propound the doctrine of violence, those who propound the doctrine of the world having an end or not having an end, those who propound the doctrine of not abandoning extremes, those who propound the doctrine of causelessness, those who propound the doctrine of annihilation,

original: med par smra ba dang / mchog tu smra ba dang / dag par smra ba dang / dge mtshan dang bkra shis su smra ba'o //
analyzed: med par smra ba dang / mchog tu smra ba dang / dag par smra ba dang / dge mtshan dang bkra shis su smra ba'o //
translated: those who propound the doctrine of nonexistence, those who propound the doctrine of the highest, those who propound the doctrine of purity, and those who propound the doctrine of auspicious signs and good fortune.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod par smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod par smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the doctrine that the effect exists in the cause?

original: 'di ltar 'di na dge spyod ngam bram ze kha cig / rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na dge spyod ngam bram ze kha cig / rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su /
translated: In this world, some virtuous practitioners or brahmins, at a time that is permanent and eternal, and at a time that is stable and enduring,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa kho na zhes de ltar lta zhing /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa kho na zhes de ltar lta zhing /
translated: say that the effect exists in the cause.

original: de skad smra ba dag yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de skad smra ba dag yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: They say this.

original: khyu mchog pa'i tshogs lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyu mchog pa'i tshogs lta bu'o //
translated: They are like the assembly of the followers of Udraka.

original: de dag kyang ci'i phyir rgyul 'bras bu yod par lta zhing rnam par 'jog la /
analyzed: de dag kyang ci'i phyir rgyul 'bras bu yod par lta zhing rnam par 'jog la /
translated: Why do they view and posit the effect as existing in the cause?

original: yongs su ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: yongs su ston par byed ce na /
translated: How does he teach?

original: 'di ltar lung dang rigs pas byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung dang rigs pas byed de /
translated: He teaches by means of scripture and reasoning.

original: lung gang zhe na /
analyzed: lung gang zhe na /
translated: What is scripture?

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa kho na'o zhes de dang ldan pa thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / sde snod byin pa'i tshul gyis de dag la 'ongs pa yin no //🔽rigs pa @61a * //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa kho na'o zhes de dang ldan pa thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / sde snod byin pa'i tshul gyis de dag la 'ongs pa yin no // rigs pa @61a * //
translated: It is the transmission of the teaching that the effect exists in the cause, which has been handed down from one person to another.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is reasoning?

original: 'di ltar dge sbyong dang / bram ze rtog ge pa dpyod pa can de nyid /🔽rtog ger rtogs pa'i sa /🔽rang gi sbobs pa las byung ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge sbyong dang / bram ze rtog ge pa dpyod pa can de nyid / rtog ger rtogs pa'i sa / rang gi sbobs pa las byung ba /
translated: It is the reasoning of the ascetics and brahmins who are speculative philosophers.🔽It is the reasoning of those who are attached to speculation.🔽It is the reasoning of those who are attached to their own ideas.

original: so so'i skye bo la dpyod pa'i rjes su spyod pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la dpyod pa'i rjes su spyod pa la gnas pa /
translated: It is the reasoning of those who are attached to the world.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think in this way:

original: dngos po gang dag las dngos po gang dag 'byung ba de dag ni de dag gi rgyu nyid du grags shing 'dogs kyi de las gzhan pa dag la ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag las dngos po gang dag 'byung ba de dag ni de dag gi rgyu nyid du grags shing 'dogs kyi de las gzhan pa dag la ma yin no //
translated: “Whatever things arise from whatever things, those things are known and designated as the cause of those things, but not anything else.

original: 'bras bu 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang 'bras bu de'i don du 'dzin par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang 'bras bu de'i don du 'dzin par byed kyi /
translated: Those who desire the effect grasp the cause in order to obtain the effect.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: and not from other things.

original: bya ba de dang de dag tu yang de dag nyid sbyor bar byed kyi /
analyzed: bya ba de dang de dag tu yang de dag nyid sbyor bar byed kyi /
translated: And it is only they that are applied to this or that action,

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: and not other things.

original: 'bras bu de yang de dag las 'byung gi de las gzhan pa rnams las ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de yang de dag las 'byung gi de las gzhan pa rnams las ma yin te /
translated: And it is only from them that the effect arises, and not from other things.

original: de bas na 'bras bu de de las yod do //
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu de de las yod do //
translated: Therefore, the effect exists in them.

original: de lta ma yin du zin na thams cad kyang thams cad kyi rgyur rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad kyang gzung ba dang / bya ba la yang thams cad du sbyar du rung ba dang / thams cad las kyang thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: de lta ma yin du zin na thams cad kyang thams cad kyi rgyur rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad kyang gzung ba dang / bya ba la yang thams cad du sbyar du rung ba dang / thams cad las kyang thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: If it were not so, then everything would be established as the cause of everything, and everything would be applicable to the apprehension and action of everything, and everything would arise from everything.

original: de 'dogs pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / bya ba la sbyor ba dang / skye ba la rtag tu rgyu la 'bras bu yod par lta'o //
analyzed: de 'dogs pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / bya ba la sbyor ba dang / skye ba la rtag tu rgyu la 'bras bu yod par lta'o //
translated: Thus, in the designation, apprehension, application to action, and arising, one always sees the effect in the cause.

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To this, the following is said:

original: ci'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu la 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dam /🔽'on te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu la 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dam / 'on te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
translated: Are you asserting that the characteristics of cause and effect are the same or different?

original: gal te tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid cig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid cig yin na ni /
translated: If they are the same,

original: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis la bye brag med pa'i phyir /🔽rgyur nges pa dang 'bras bur nges pa med pas /
analyzed: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis la bye brag med pa'i phyir / rgyur nges pa dang 'bras bur nges pa med pas /
translated: then because there would be no distinction between cause and effect,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod ces byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: it would not be tenable to say that the effect exists in the cause because there would be no certainty of cause and effect.

original: gal te mtshan nyid tha dad pa zhig yin na ni /🔽des na ci ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid tha dad pa zhig yin na ni / des na ci ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: If they are different,

original: 'on te skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
translated: then is the characteristic of the effect that which has not yet arisen or is it that which has already arisen?

original: gal te ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid cig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid cig yin na ni /
translated: If it is the characteristic of that which has not yet arisen,

original: des na rgyu la 'bras bu ma skyes pa zhig yod do zhes bya ba yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na rgyu la 'bras bu ma skyes pa zhig yod do zhes bya ba yang mi rung ngo //
translated: then it would not be tenable to say that the effect exists in the cause.

original: gal te skyes zin pa'i mtshan nyid cig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te skyes zin pa'i mtshan nyid cig yin na ni /
translated: If it is the characteristic of that which has already arisen,

original: des na rgyu la 'bras bu skyes zin pa zhig skye'o zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na rgyu la 'bras bu skyes zin pa zhig skye'o zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to say that an effect already arisen arises from a cause.

original: de bas na rgyu la ni 'bras bu med kyi /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu la ni 'bras bu med kyi /
translated: Thus, an effect does not exist in the cause.

original: rgyu yod na rkyen la ltos te @61b skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽de la mtshan nyid rnam pa lngas ni mtshan nyid yod pa'i chos la mtshan nyid yod pa'i chos yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu yod na rkyen la ltos te @61b skye bar 'gyur ro // de la mtshan nyid rnam pa lngas ni mtshan nyid yod pa'i chos la mtshan nyid yod pa'i chos yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: But when the cause exists, the effect arises in dependence on conditions.🔽In this regard, the existence of a phenomenon with a characteristic should be understood through five aspects:🔽1. the object of observation that is in its vicinity,🔽2. the object of observation that is its basis,

original: de'i phyogs na dmigs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyogs na dmigs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: 3. the object of observation that is its own nature,🔽4. the object of observation that is its transformation,🔽and 5. the object of observation that is the transformation of its conditions.

original: bum pa'i nang na chu 'dug pa lta bu dang / de'i rten la dmigs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bum pa'i nang na chu 'dug pa lta bu dang / de'i rten la dmigs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: 1. The object of observation that is in its vicinity is like water in a pot.

original: mig la mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu dang / de nyid bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid du dmigs pa 'di lta ste /🔽rgyu ni rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mig la mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu dang / de nyid bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid du dmigs pa 'di lta ste / rgyu ni rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: 2. The object of observation that is its basis is like the eye consciousness in the eye.

original: rang gi las byed pa lta bu dang / rgyu 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rang gi las byed pa lta bu dang / rgyu 'gyur ba'am /
translated: 3. The object of observation that is its own nature is like a cause that is not to be inferred and that performs its own function.

original: yang na 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnams kyis 'gyur bar 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnams kyis 'gyur bar 'ong ba'o //
translated: 4. The object of observation that is its transformation is like a cause that transforms or is transformed by conditions.🔽5. The object of observation that is the transformation of its conditions is like the transformation of the conditions of a cause.

original: de'i phyir yang rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug gi dus su rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa kho nar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug gi dus su rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa kho nar mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible that the effect exists in the cause at all times and at all moments.

original: rnam grangs des na yang 'di ni smra bar rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na yang 'di ni smra bar rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa kho na'o //
translated: For this reason also, this is not a proper assertion.

original: de ltar na bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bye brag yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bye brag yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is not possible by the characteristics of the non-distinction, the distinction, the non-arisen, and the arisen.

original: mngon par gsal bar smra ba gang zhe na /🔽'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig / dngos po yod pa nyid mngon par gsal bar byed par zad kyi /
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar smra ba gang zhe na / 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig / dngos po yod pa nyid mngon par gsal bar byed par zad kyi /
translated: What is the theory of manifestation?🔽There are some śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas who assert the following:

original: skye ba ni ma yin no zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ba dag yod do //
analyzed: skye ba ni ma yin no zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ba dag yod do //
translated: “Only an existent thing is manifested, not a non-existent thing.”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod par smra ba de nyid dang / sgra'i mtshan nyid smra ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod par smra ba de nyid dang / sgra'i mtshan nyid smra ba lta bu'o //
translated: those who assert that the effect exists in the cause and those who assert the characteristics of sound.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod par smra ba rnams /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod par smra ba rnams /
translated: Those who maintain that the effect exists in the cause

original: ci'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa la mngon par gsal bar lta bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa la mngon par gsal bar lta bar byed ce na /
translated: why do they maintain that the effect exists in the cause?

original: lung dang rigs pas byed de /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas byed de /
translated: They do so through scripture and reasoning.

original: lung ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lung ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The scripture is the same as before.

original: rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning?

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig bdag nyid rtog ge ba dpyod pa can zhes bya ba nas snga ma kho na bzhin du rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig bdag nyid rtog ge ba dpyod pa can zhes bya ba nas snga ma kho na bzhin du rgyas par bya'o //
translated: For example, some people are called “logicians” and “analysts” and so on, as before at length.

original: de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think as follows:

original: rgyu la 'bras bu med na skye bar mi rung la /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu med na skye bar mi rung la /
translated: If the effect does not exist in the cause, it cannot arise.

original: 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par mi byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par mi byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that one does not strive to achieve the effect.

original: de yang ci'i phyir byed ce na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir byed ce na /
translated: Why do they do that?

original: mngon par gsal ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro snyam ste /
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro snyam ste /
translated: They do so in order to manifest it.

original: de de ltar yongs su brtags nas /
analyzed: de de ltar yongs su brtags nas /
translated: Having investigated in this way,

original: mngon par gsal bar smra bar gyur to //
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar smra bar gyur to //
translated: they become proponents of manifestation.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu mngon par smra ba de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu mngon par smra ba de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To those who maintain that the effect exists in the cause, one should say the following:

original: ci sgrib pa'i rgyu med pa 'am sgrib pa yod par 'dod /🔽gal @62a * //
analyzed: ci sgrib pa'i rgyu med pa 'am sgrib pa yod par 'dod / gal @62a * //
translated: Is it that there is no cause for obscuration, or that there is obscuration?

original: te med du zin na ni sgrib pa'i rgyu med pa zhig gis bsgribs so zhes bya bar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: te med du zin na ni sgrib pa'i rgyu med pa zhig gis bsgribs so zhes bya bar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is the case that there is no cause, then it is not tenable to say that it is obscured by something that is without a cause for obscuration.

original: gal te yod na ni yod par yang 'dra na /
analyzed: gal te yod na ni yod par yang 'dra na /
translated: If it is the case that there is a cause, then since it is the same in existing,

original: 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i rgyu la yang ci'i phyir sgrib par mi byed de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i rgyu la yang ci'i phyir sgrib par mi byed de mi rung ngo //
translated: why does it not obscure the cause that is related to the effect? It is not tenable.

original: dper na mun pas rdza ma'i nang gi chu bsgribs pa na /
analyzed: dper na mun pas rdza ma'i nang gi chu bsgribs pa na /
translated: For example, when darkness obscures the water in a clay pot,

original: rdza ma la yang sgrib par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rdza ma la yang sgrib par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: it also obscures the clay pot.

original: gal te rgyu yang sgrib pa'i rgyus bsgribs na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu yang sgrib pa'i rgyus bsgribs na ni /
translated: If the cause is obscured by the cause of obscuration,

original: des na rgyu la 'bras bu yod ba mngon par gsal bar byed kyi /
analyzed: des na rgyu la 'bras bu yod ba mngon par gsal bar byed kyi /
translated: then it is the effect that is present in the cause that is made manifest,

original: rgyu gsal bar mi byed ces byar ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu gsal bar mi byed ces byar ni mi rung ngo //
translated: but it is not tenable to say that the cause is made manifest.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /🔽ci yod pa nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin nam /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste / ci yod pa nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin nam /
translated: In this regard, it should be said:🔽Is it the case that existence is the cause of obscuration,

original: 'on te 'bras bu nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin /
translated: or is it the case that the effect itself is the cause of obscuration?

original: gal te yod pa nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin na ni /
translated: If the cause of obscuration is existence,

original: des ni rgyu yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni rgyu yang yod pa yin te /
translated: then the cause would also exist.

original: yod pa ni dus thams cad du mngon par gsal ba ma yin par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yod pa ni dus thams cad du mngon par gsal ba ma yin par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: But it is not tenable that what exists is not manifest at all times.

original: gal te 'bras bu nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu nyid sgrib pa'i rgyu yin na ni /
translated: If the cause of obscuration is the effect itself,

original: des na la la'i rgyu yang de nyid yin la /
analyzed: des na la la'i rgyu yang de nyid yin la /
translated: then for some, the cause would be that itself,

original: 'bras bu yang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang de nyid yin te /
translated: and the effect would be that itself.

original: dper na myu gu ni sa bon gyi 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na myu gu ni sa bon gyi 'bras bu yin la /
translated: For example, a sprout is the effect of a seed,

original: sdong bu la sogs pa'i ni rgyu yin te /🔽de bas na mngon par gsal ba yang de nyid yin la /
analyzed: sdong bu la sogs pa'i ni rgyu yin te / de bas na mngon par gsal ba yang de nyid yin la /
translated: but it is the cause of the stem, etc.

original: mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa yang de nyid yin zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa yang de nyid yin zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that it is manifest and also not manifest.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /🔽ci chos de las mngon par gsal ba tha dad pa ma yin pa 'am /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste / ci chos de las mngon par gsal ba tha dad pa ma yin pa 'am /
translated: In this regard, this should be said:

original: 'on te tha dad par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad par 'dod /
translated: Is the manifest of that phenomenon not different or is it different?

original: gal te tha dad ba ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te tha dad ba ma yin na ni /
translated: If it is not different,

original: rtag tu mngon par gsal ba'i chos yin pas /
analyzed: rtag tu mngon par gsal ba'i chos yin pas /
translated: then the phenomenon would always be manifest.

original: mngon par gsal ba mngon par gsal bar byed do zhes byar mi rung ngo//
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba mngon par gsal bar byed do zhes byar mi rung ngo//
translated: It is not tenable to say that that which is manifest makes that which is manifest manifest.

original: gal te tha dad na ni des na de rgyu med pa zhig gam /
analyzed: gal te tha dad na ni des na de rgyu med pa zhig gam /
translated: If they are different, then it would be causeless.

original: rgyu yod pa zhig yin /
analyzed: rgyu yod pa zhig yin /
translated: Or it would have a cause.

original: gal te rgyu med pa zhig yin na ni des na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pa zhig yin na ni des na /
translated: If it is causeless,

original: rgyu med pa mngon par gsal bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu med pa mngon par gsal bar mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not tenable that that which is manifest is causeless.

original: gal te rgyu yod pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu yod pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If it has a cause,

original: des na mngon par gsal bar ma gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na mngon par gsal bar ma gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: then because it is not manifest,

original: 'bras bur gyur pa mngon par gsal bas mngon par gsal bar byar yang mi rung ngo /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa mngon par gsal bas mngon par gsal bar byar yang mi rung ngo /
translated: it is not tenable that that which is manifest makes that which is not manifest manifest.

original: des na sgrib pa'i rgyu med pa dang / sgrib pa'i rgyu yod pa dang / yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon par gsal ba tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / mngon par gsal ba tha dad pa las kyang @62b mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na sgrib pa'i rgyu med pa dang / sgrib pa'i rgyu yod pa dang / yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon par gsal ba tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / mngon par gsal ba tha dad pa las kyang @62b mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the cause of obscuration is nonexistent, that the cause of obscuration exists, that the characteristic of existence, the characteristic of the effect, and manifestation are not different, and that manifestation is different.

original: de bas na dngos po med pa gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid de ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid de ni med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of that which is nonexistent is just nonexistence.

original: dngos po yod pa gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid de ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid de ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of that which exists is existence.

original: med pa'i med pa nyid ni mngon par gsal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i med pa nyid ni mngon par gsal ba med pa yin no //
translated: The nonexistence of nonexistence is nonmanifestation.

original: yod pa'i yod pa nyid ni mngon par gsal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i yod pa nyid ni mngon par gsal ba nyid yin no //
translated: The existence of existence is manifestation.

original: yod pa ji ltar 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba de'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yod pa ji ltar 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba de'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: The characteristic of that which is not apprehended should be explained.

original: yod pa yang thag ring bas mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: yod pa yang thag ring bas mi 'dzin la /
translated: That which exists is not apprehended because it is distant.

original: sgrib ba'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi po /
analyzed: sgrib ba'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi po /
translated: The four kinds of causes of obstruction are:🔽obstruction by a screen, obstruction by nonvisibility, obstruction by suppression, and obstruction by deception of the eye.

original: sgrib g-yogs dang / mi snang bar byed pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / mig slu bar byed pas bsgribs pa dang / chung ba dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / dbang po med par gyur cing nyams pa dang / de dang ldan pa'i shes pa ma byung bas kyang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrib g-yogs dang / mi snang bar byed pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / mig slu bar byed pas bsgribs pa dang / chung ba dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / dbang po med par gyur cing nyams pa dang / de dang ldan pa'i shes pa ma byung bas kyang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is small, that which is distracted, that which is without a sense organ, and that which is defective are not apprehended because the corresponding cognition does not occur.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu mngon par gsal bar smra ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu mngon par gsal bar smra ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the effect is manifested in the cause,

original: sgrar smra ba yang rigs pa ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgrar smra ba yang rigs pa ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The theory of sound is also to be regarded as unreasonable.

original: de la sgrar smra ba'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sgrar smra ba'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the difference between the two theories.

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid ni ji skad 'dogs pa kho na bzhin du rnam par gnas par lta la /🔽rnam par gnas pa de yang dang yang du brjod pa'i tshul gyis smra ba las /
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid ni ji skad 'dogs pa kho na bzhin du rnam par gnas par lta la / rnam par gnas pa de yang dang yang du brjod pa'i tshul gyis smra ba las /
translated: The sound theorist maintains that sound exists just as it is conceived,

original: mngon par gsal bar 'gyur bar lta ste /🔽des na de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar 'gyur bar lta ste / des na de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: and that it becomes manifest through the repetition of the sound.

original: sgra ni rtag go snyam mo //
analyzed: sgra ni rtag go snyam mo //
translated: Thus he thinks that sound is permanent.

original: de bas na mngon par gsal bar smra ba yang rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon par gsal bar smra ba yang rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the theory of manifestation is also unreasonable.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod par smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod par smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the theory of the substantial reality of the past and future?

original: 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze 'am /🔽chos 'di la kha cig kyang 'das pa yang yod /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze 'am / chos 'di la kha cig kyang 'das pa yang yod /
translated: Here some śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas

original: ma 'ongs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang yod de /
translated: maintain that the past and future exist,

original: da ltar byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba bzhin du /
translated: just as the present does,

original: mtshan nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin te /
translated: and that they are established by their characteristics.

original: rdzas su yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa yin gyi /
translated: They exist substantially.

original: brtags pa'i yod pa ni ma yin no zhes tshul bzhin ma yin pas de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: brtags pa'i yod pa ni ma yin no zhes tshul bzhin ma yin pas de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: They do not exist as designations.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar lta zhing de skad smra bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar lta zhing de skad smra bar byed ce na /
translated: Why do they view and speak in this way?

original: lung dang rigs pas byed de /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas byed de /
translated: They do so through scripture and reasoning.

original: lung gang zhe na /
analyzed: lung gang zhe na /
translated: What is the scripture?

original: de ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as above.

original: chos 'di pa yang mdo sde la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog ste /
analyzed: chos 'di pa yang mdo sde la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog ste /
translated: They also think about the sūtras in an incorrect way.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: skye mched bcu gnyis po thams cad yod de skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams ni mtshan nyid kyis yod do //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis po thams cad yod de skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams ni mtshan nyid kyis yod do //
translated: they say, “All twelve sense bases exist. The twelve sense bases exist by their characteristics.

original: bcom ldan 'das @63a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @63a * //
translated: The Blessed One

original: kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: has said, ‘For example,

original: 'das pa'i las ni yod do //
analyzed: 'das pa'i las ni yod do //
translated: past karma exists.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'das pa'i gzugs ni yod do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'das pa'i gzugs ni yod do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: For example,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du yod do zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du yod do zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: past form exists’ up to ‘future consciousness exists.’

original: tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog go //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog go //
translated: They think about this in an incorrect way.

original: rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning?

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig rtog ge pa dpyod pa can zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig rtog ge pa dpyod pa can zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In this way, some say, “There are those who are called logicians.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: . . . as before.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think this:

original: chos gang rang gi mtshan nyid gang gis rnam par gnas pa de ni /
analyzed: chos gang rang gi mtshan nyid gang gis rnam par gnas pa de ni /
translated: Any phenomenon that is established by its own characteristic

original: des yongs su grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des yongs su grub pa yin no //
translated: is fully established by that.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa de med du zin na ni /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa de med du zin na ni /
translated: If that future thing did not exist,

original: des na de'i tshe /
analyzed: des na de'i tshe /
translated: then at that time

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be established by its own characteristic.

original: gal te 'das pa med du zin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa med du zin na ni /
translated: If the past did not exist,

original: des na de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time it would be devoid of its own characteristic.

original: de ltar gyur na rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su ma grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su ma grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, it would not be fully established by its own characteristic.

original: de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid ni yongs su ma grub ces bya bar mi rung ngo snyam ste /🔽des na de 'das pa yang yod /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid ni yongs su ma grub ces bya bar mi rung ngo snyam ste / des na de 'das pa yang yod /
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to say that it is not fully established by its own characteristic.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang yod ces de ltar lta zhing de skad smra'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang yod ces de ltar lta zhing de skad smra'o //
translated: Therefore they say, ‘The past exists and the future exists,’ and they view it in that way and teach it in that way.

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: In response to that, this should be said to them:

original: ci 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dam /🔽'on te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
analyzed: ci 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dam / 'on te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
translated: Is the characteristic of the past and the future the same as the characteristic of the present, or is it a different characteristic?

original: gal te tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is the same characteristic,

original: mtshan nyid dus gsum du rnam par gzhag tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dus gsum du rnam par gzhag tu mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not suitable to posit the characteristic in the three times.

original: gal te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is a different characteristic,

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ces byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not suitable to call it the characteristic of the perfected.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /🔽ci dus su gtogs pa'i chos rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste / ci dus su gtogs pa'i chos rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: Here, this should be said:🔽Is the characteristic of a permanent phenomenon included in time,

original: 'on te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
translated: or is it the characteristic of an impermanent phenomenon?

original: gal te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is the characteristic of a permanent phenomenon,

original: dus gsum du gtogs pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dus gsum du gtogs pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not suitable to call it included in the three times.

original: gal te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is the characteristic of an impermanent phenomenon,🔽then it is not suitable to call it the characteristic of the perfected.

original: des na dus gsum du de kho na bzhin du yod do zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na dus gsum du de kho na bzhin du yod do zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that it exists in the three times just as it is.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, one should say the following:

original: ci ma 'ongs pa da ltar gyi dus su 'ong bar mthong ngam /
analyzed: ci ma 'ongs pa da ltar gyi dus su 'ong bar mthong ngam /
translated: Do you see the future coming into the present?

original: 'phos nas skye 'am /
analyzed: 'phos nas skye 'am /
translated: Or does it arise after it has moved?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i de kho na bzhin du 'dug la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i de kho na bzhin du 'dug la /
translated: Or does the future remain just as it is,

original: de la brten te da ltar skye 'am /
analyzed: de la brten te da ltar skye 'am /
translated: and does the present arise in dependence on it?

original: las mi byed pa zhig las /
analyzed: las mi byed pa zhig las /
translated: Or does it arise from that which is not performing an action?

original: las byed bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: las byed bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Or does it arise from that which is performing an action?

original: mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa zhig las mtshan nyid rdzogs par @63b 'gyur ram /🔽mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa zhig las mtshan nyid rdzogs par @63b 'gyur ram / mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Or does it arise from that which is incomplete in terms of its characteristics?🔽Or does it arise from that which is complete in terms of its characteristics?🔽Or does it arise from that which is not different in terms of its characteristics?🔽Or does it arise from that which is different in terms of its characteristics?

original: ma 'ongs par 'gyur ba zhig da ltar gyi dngos por 'gyur gal te 'ong ba zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: ma 'ongs par 'gyur ba zhig da ltar gyi dngos por 'gyur gal te 'ong ba zhig yin na ni /
translated: If it is coming,

original: des na yul na gnas par yang 'gyur la /🔽da ltar dang yang bye brag med da /
analyzed: des na yul na gnas par yang 'gyur la / da ltar dang yang bye brag med da /
translated: then it would be in a place,🔽and there would be no difference between the future and the present.

original: ther zug par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ther zug par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: But that is unacceptable, because it would be permanent.

original: gal te 'phos nas skye bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'phos nas skye bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: If it arises after it has moved,

original: des na ma 'ongs pa yang ma skyes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na ma 'ongs pa yang ma skyes par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, the future would not arise.

original: sngon ma byung ba yang skyes par 'gyur ba dang / ma skyes pa yang 'pho bar 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba yang skyes par 'gyur ba dang / ma skyes pa yang 'pho bar 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that what has not occurred previously would arise, and that which has not arisen would be transferred.

original: gal te de kho na bzhin du 'dug la /
analyzed: gal te de kho na bzhin du 'dug la /
translated: If it were to remain just as it is,

original: de la brten te skye bar 'gyur na yang /
analyzed: de la brten te skye bar 'gyur na yang /
translated: and it were to arise in dependence on that,

original: des na ther zug par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na ther zug par yang 'gyur la /
translated: then it would be permanent,

original: sngon ma byung ba yang skyes par 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //🔽gal te las mi byed pa yin pa las /
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba yang skyes par 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir mi rung ngo // gal te las mi byed pa yin pa las /
translated: and it would not be tenable that what has not occurred previously would arise, and that the future would not arise.

original: las byed par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: las byed par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the action that is not being performed were to become the action that is being performed,

original: des na ma byung ba byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na ma byung ba byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: then that which has not occurred would occur.

original: skyon snga ma rnams ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo //🔽las de yang ci de dang tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: skyon snga ma rnams ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo // las de yang ci de dang tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: Since the previous errors would be just the same, that is also untenable.🔽Moreover, is that action asserted to have a characteristic that is different from it,

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
translated: or to have a characteristic that is not different from it?

original: gal te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it has a characteristic that is different from it,

original: de'i ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid med pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid med pas mi rung ngo //
translated: But it is not tenable that it is the characteristic of the future because it does not exist.

original: gal te tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /🔽des na las mi byed pa yin pa las /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni / des na las mi byed pa yin pa las /
translated: If it is the characteristic of that which is not different,🔽then it is not tenable to say that it is not an action,

original: las byed par 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: las byed par 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: but that it becomes an action.

original: las mi byed pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: las mi byed pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is not an action,

original: mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa dang / mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa dang / mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: so too, it is not tenable that it is a characteristic that is not complete, a characteristic that is different, or the characteristic of a future thing.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yin te rang bzhin 'dres pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yin te rang bzhin 'dres pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: The difference is this: it is not tenable because the error of mixing natures exists.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is with the future and the present,

original: da ltar dang 'das pa la yang gtan tshigs 'di dag nyid dang / lan gyi lam 'di nyid kyis /
analyzed: da ltar dang 'das pa la yang gtan tshigs 'di dag nyid dang / lan gyi lam 'di nyid kyis /
translated: so too, with respect to the present and the past, these very arguments and this very path of response

original: ci rigs par skyon dang ldan par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: ci rigs par skyon dang ldan par blta bar bya ste /
translated: should be applied as appropriate to show the error.

original: de ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / 'ongs pa dang / 'phos pa dang / brten te skye ba dang / las dang mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa dang / mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos pos kyang 'das pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / 'ongs pa dang / 'phos pa dang / brten te skye ba dang / las dang mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa dang / mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos pos kyang 'das pa dang /
translated: Thus, it is also not tenable to say that the past and future exist due to their own specific characteristics, their general characteristics, their coming, their going, their dependent origination, their incomplete characteristics, their dissimilar characteristics, and their future things.🔽

original: ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod par smra ba mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod par smra ba mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus it is illogical to say that the past and future substantially exist because of intrinsic characteristics, general characteristics, coming, going, dependent origination, karma, incomplete characteristics, dissimilar characteristics, and the entity of the future.

original: de skad du lan btab kyang @64a * //
analyzed: de skad du lan btab kyang @64a * //
translated: Even though this response is given,

original: yang 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: yang 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: they may still say,

original: gal te 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa med du zin na /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa med du zin na /
translated: “If the past and future do not exist,

original: dmigs pa med pa la ji ltar blo 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa la ji ltar blo 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: how could the mind engage with that which is not an object?”

original: gal te 'jug na yang skye mched bcu gnyis po thams cad yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i lung dang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur zhes zer ba de la /
analyzed: gal te 'jug na yang skye mched bcu gnyis po thams cad yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i lung dang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur zhes zer ba de la /
translated: “If it does engage, how could this not contradict the scriptures that state, ‘All twelve sense bases exist’?”

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To this we would reply,

original: ci 'jig rten na med do zhes 'dzin pa'i blo mi 'jug gam /
analyzed: ci 'jig rten na med do zhes 'dzin pa'i blo mi 'jug gam /
translated: “Does the mind not engage with the world’s statement ‘It does not exist’?

original: 'on te 'jug par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te 'jug par 'dod /
translated: Or do you assert that it does?”

original: gal te mi 'jug na ni des na bdag med par 'dzin pa dang / rvi bong gi ra dang / mo gsham gyi bu la sogs par 'dzin pa blo gang yin pa de yang med pa kho na'o zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mi 'jug na ni des na bdag med par 'dzin pa dang / rvi bong gi ra dang / mo gsham gyi bu la sogs par 'dzin pa blo gang yin pa de yang med pa kho na'o zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it does not engage, then it is not tenable to say that the mind that apprehends selflessness, the mind that apprehends the horns of a rabbit, and the mind that apprehends the son of a barren woman are nonexistent.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos g-yo med pa ni ngas gdams ngag byin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos g-yo med pa ni ngas gdams ngag byin te /
translated: It would also be untenable for the Bhagavān to say, “I give instruction to the śrāvakas who are without guile.

original: yang dag par sgrub na /
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub na /
translated: If they practice correctly,

original: yod pa la yang yod par shes /
analyzed: yod pa la yang yod par shes /
translated: they will know existence as existence and

original: med pa la yang med par shes so zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa la yang med par shes so zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will know nonexistence as nonexistence.”

original: gal te 'jug na ni de lta na ci blo de yod do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa 'am /
analyzed: gal te 'jug na ni de lta na ci blo de yod do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa 'am /
translated: If it engages, then in that case, do you assert that the mind has the aspect of thinking “it exists”

original: med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par 'dod /
analyzed: med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par 'dod /
translated: or the aspect of thinking “it does not exist”?

original: gal te yod do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te yod do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa yin na ni /
translated: If it has the aspect of thinking “it exists,”

original: des na med par 'dzin pa'i blo yod do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par 'gyur du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na med par 'dzin pa'i blo yod do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par 'gyur du mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not tenable to say that the mind that apprehends nonexistence has the aspect of thinking “it exists.”

original: gal te med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa yin na ni /
translated: If it is the aspect of thinking “it does not exist,”

original: des na med pa'i rnam pa'i blo de /🔽ci dngos po yod pa la 'jug gam /
analyzed: des na med pa'i rnam pa'i blo de / ci dngos po yod pa la 'jug gam /
translated: then that mind that has the aspect of nonexistence🔽would you assert that it engages an existent thing

original: med pa la 'jug par 'dod /
analyzed: med pa la 'jug par 'dod /
translated: or that it engages a nonexistent thing?

original: gal te yod pa la 'jug na ni /
analyzed: gal te yod pa la 'jug na ni /
translated: If it engages an existent thing,

original: des na med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa'i blo dngos po yod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa'i blo dngos po yod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not tenable that the mind that has the aspect of thinking “it does not exist” engages an existent thing.

original: gal te dngos po med pa la 'jug na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa la 'jug na ni /
translated: If it engages a nonexistent thing,

original: des na dmigs pa med pa la blo 'jug pa med do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa med pa la blo 'jug pa med do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not tenable to say that the mind does not engage a nonexistent object.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis po ji snyed pa thams cad yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis po ji snyed pa thams cad yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang /
translated: The statement “All twelve sense bases exist”

original: yod pa la yod pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa dang med pa la med pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yod pa la yod pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa dang med pa la med pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: is made with the intention that existence has the characteristic of existence and nonexistence has the characteristic of nonexistence.

original: 'di ltar yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams kyang /
translated: Thus phenomena that have the characteristic of existence

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin la /
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin la /
translated: retain the characteristic of existence.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams kyang med pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin te /
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams kyang med pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin te /
translated: And also, the characteristics of non-existent phenomena are apprehended as non-existent.

original: de bas na chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called “phenomena.”

original: de lta ma yin du zin na yod pa mi shes @64b pa dang / med pa mi shes pas rnal 'byor pas shes bya'i chos la rgyun chags su rtog par mi 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin du zin na yod pa mi shes @64b pa dang / med pa mi shes pas rnal 'byor pas shes bya'i chos la rgyun chags su rtog par mi 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: If that were not so, since the existent would not be known and the non-existent would not be known, the yogin would not continuously investigate the phenomena that are objects of knowledge.

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i tshor ba myong bar byed pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i tshor ba myong bar byed pas /
translated: Thus, since sentient beings experience feelings that are painful and painless,

original: 'das pa'i las yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de la yang /
analyzed: 'das pa'i las yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de la yang /
translated: it is said that past karma exists.

original: bag chags de la de yod pa'i 'dogs pa las dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bag chags de la de yod pa'i 'dogs pa las dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: That is stated with the intention of designating that latent tendency as existing.

original: 'du byed gang dag la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las skyes nas 'gags pa yod la /
analyzed: 'du byed gang dag la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las skyes nas 'gags pa yod la /
translated: In those formations, virtuous and non-virtuous karma arises and ceases.

original: rgyu de dang rkyen des 'du byed bye brag can gyi rgyud 'jug pa de la ni bag chags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen des 'du byed bye brag can gyi rgyud 'jug pa de la ni bag chags zhes bya ste /
translated: The continuum of specific formations that are engaged by that cause and condition is called a latent tendency.

original: de rgyun du gnas pa las sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rung ste /
analyzed: de rgyun du gnas pa las sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rung ste /
translated: because the effect of the pleasant and the unpleasant is established from the continuous existence of that.

original: de'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: 'das pa'i gzugs yod do //
analyzed: 'das pa'i gzugs yod do //
translated: Form of the past exists.

original: ma 'ongs pa yod do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yod do //
translated: The future exists.

original: da ltar byung ba yod do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yod do //
translated: The present exists.🔽And so on up to: consciousness exists.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de la yang 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du yod do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de la yang 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: This was said with the intention that the three aspects of the characteristic of formation exist.

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid las dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid las dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The characteristic of cause, the characteristic of intrinsic nature, and the characteristic of effect.

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid las dgongs nas ma 'ongs pa'i yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid las dgongs nas ma 'ongs pa'i yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: With the intention that the characteristic of cause exists, it was said, “The future exists.”

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa 'di las dgongs nas da ltar byung ba yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa 'di las dgongs nas da ltar byung ba yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: With the intention that the characteristic of intrinsic nature exists, it was said, “The present exists.”

original: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid las dgongs nas 'das pa yod do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid las dgongs nas 'das pa yod do zhes gsungs te /
translated: With the intention that the characteristic of effect exists, it was said, “The past exists.”

original: de'i phyir na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: gzhan yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid de ltar rdzas su ni mi rung gi / ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid de ltar rdzas su ni mi rung gi / ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the characteristics of the past and future are not suitable as real substances, but the characteristics of the future should be understood as existing in twelve ways.

original: rgyur rab tu phye ba dang / lus ma skyes pa dang / rkyen la ltos pa dang / skyes pa dang 'dra ba dang / skye ba'i chos can dang / mi skye ba'i chos can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa dang /
analyzed: rgyur rab tu phye ba dang / lus ma skyes pa dang / rkyen la ltos pa dang / skyes pa dang 'dra ba dang / skye ba'i chos can dang / mi skye ba'i chos can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa dang /
translated: They are distinguished as causes, the body is not arisen, it depends on conditions, it is similar to what has arisen, it has the attribute of arising, it has the attribute of nonarising, afflicted phenomena have not arisen,

original: rnam par byang ba ma skyes pa dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / brtag tu rung ba dang brtag tu rung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma skyes pa dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / brtag tu rung ba dang brtag tu rung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: purified phenomena have not arisen, it is desirable, it is undesirable, it is suitable to be investigated, and it is not suitable to be investigated.

original: da ltar byung ba la yang mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gnyis yod de /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la yang mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gnyis yod de /
translated: The present also has twelve characteristics.

original: 'bras bu rab tu phye ba dang / lus skyes pa dang / rkyen dang ldan pa dang / skyes pa dang 'dra ba dang / skad cig pa dang / mi skye @65a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu rab tu phye ba dang / lus skyes pa dang / rkyen dang ldan pa dang / skyes pa dang 'dra ba dang / skad cig pa dang / mi skye @65a * //
translated: They are distinguished as effects, the body has arisen, it possesses conditions, it is similar to what has arisen, it is momentary, it does not arise again,

original: ba'i chos can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / brtag tu rung ba dang / brtag tu rung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i chos can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / brtag tu rung ba dang / brtag tu rung ba ma yin pa'o //
