translated: the past, the future, the present, the internal, the external, the gross, the subtle, the distant, the near, the defiled, the purified, the agreeable, the disagreeable, the surpassable, and the unsurpassable.

original: 'das pa la yang mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'das pa la yang mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The past also has twelve characteristics:

original: rgyu 'das pa dang / rkyen 'das pa dang / 'bras bu 'das pa dang / lus zhig pa dang / 'gags pa'i rang bzhin can dang / mi skye ba'i chos can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zhi ba dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par zhi ba dang /
analyzed: rgyu 'das pa dang / rkyen 'das pa dang / 'bras bu 'das pa dang / lus zhig pa dang / 'gags pa'i rang bzhin can dang / mi skye ba'i chos can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zhi ba dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par zhi ba dang /
translated: the past cause, the past condition, the past effect, the disintegration of the body, the nature of cessation, the non-arising of dharmas, the pacification of defilements, the pacification of purification,

original: ltas pa'i gnas lta bu dang / ltos pa ma yin pa'i gnas lta bu dang / brtag tu rung ba dang / brtag tu rung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ltas pa'i gnas lta bu dang / ltos pa ma yin pa'i gnas lta bu dang / brtag tu rung ba dang / brtag tu rung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: the state of being an object of observation, the state of not being an object of observation, the surpassable, and the unsurpassable.

original: bdag tu smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the theory of self?

original: 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam /
translated: It is this: Here a śramaṇa or a brāhmaṇa is a speculator about the future, holding a doctrine of self-existence in the future, and he asserts:

original: bram ze kha cig 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bram ze kha cig 'di lta ste /
translated: Some Brahmins,

original: 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa'i mu stegs can /
translated: those who are outside this doctrine,🔽those who are tīrthikas,

original: bdag gam sems can nam /
analyzed: bdag gam sems can nam /
translated: say that a self, a sentient being,

original: srog gam / skye ba po 'am /🔽gso ba 'am /🔽skyes bu 'am /
analyzed: srog gam / skye ba po 'am / gso ba 'am / skyes bu 'am /
translated: a life-force, a person,🔽a human,

original: gang zag gam /
analyzed: gang zag gam /
translated: an individual,

original: de la sogs pa bden par gnas par yod do zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ba dag yod de /
analyzed: de la sogs pa bden par gnas par yod do zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ba dag yod de /
translated: and so on, truly exist.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar lta zhing de skad smra bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar lta zhing de skad smra bar byed ce na /
translated: Why do they say this?

original: lung dang rigs pas byed de /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas byed de /
translated: They do so through scripture and reasoning.

original: de la lung ni snga ma kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: de la lung ni snga ma kho na bzhin no //
translated: Their scripture is the same as before.

original: rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is their reasoning?

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig rtog ge pa dpyod pa can zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig rtog ge pa dpyod pa can zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Some here are called logicians.

original: blo sngon du btang ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: blo sngon du btang ba ma yin pas /
translated: They do not use the mind as a basis.

original: yod pa la sems can gyi blo 'jug pa dmigs pa dang / blo sngon du btang nas spyod pa dmigs pa dang / rnam pa gnyis kyis de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yod pa la sems can gyi blo 'jug pa dmigs pa dang / blo sngon du btang nas spyod pa dmigs pa dang / rnam pa gnyis kyis de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They observe that the mind of sentient beings engages with what exists and that it engages with what is observed after using the mind as a basis.

original: gal te bdag med du zin na /
analyzed: gal te bdag med du zin na /
translated: They think, “If there is no self,

original: dngos po rnam pa lnga mthong ba na /
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa lnga mthong ba na /
translated: When one sees the five types of things,

original: rnam pa lngas bdag tu blo 'jug par 'gyur ba'i mi rigs te /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas bdag tu blo 'jug par 'gyur ba'i mi rigs te /
translated: it is not reasonable for the mind to engage with a self in five ways.

original: gzugs kyi dbyibs mthong na gzugs kyi blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs kyi /
analyzed: gzugs kyi dbyibs mthong na gzugs kyi blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs kyi /
translated: If one sees the shape of a form, it is reasonable for the mind to engage with form alone.

original: sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable for the mind to engage with a sentient being.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis g-yen spyo ba'i 'du byed mthong na /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis g-yen spyo ba'i 'du byed mthong na /
translated: If one sees the formations that are tormented by pleasure and pain,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs kyi /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs kyi /
translated: it is reasonable for the mind to engage with feeling and so on alone.

original: sems can la dmas pa dang mthos pa'i blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: sems can la dmas pa dang mthos pa'i blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable for the mind to engage with the superiority or inferiority of a sentient being.

original: ming dang ldan pa ming dang 'brel ba'i 'du byed mthong na /
analyzed: ming dang ldan pa ming dang 'brel ba'i 'du byed mthong na /
translated: If one sees the formations that are associated with and related to names,

original: 'du shes kyi blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs @65b kyi /🔽rgyal rigs sam /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs @65b kyi / rgyal rigs sam /
translated: it is reasonable for the mind to engage with discernment alone.🔽It is not reasonable for the mind to engage with a sentient being.🔽If one sees the formations that are associated with and related to a kṣatriya,

original: bram ze 'am /
analyzed: bram ze 'am /
translated: a brahmin,🔽a vaiśya,

original: rje'u rigs sam /🔽dmangs rigs sam /
analyzed: rje'u rigs sam / dmangs rigs sam /
translated: or a śūdra,

original: sangs rgyas byin nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas byin nam /
translated: a buddha,🔽or a virtuous friend,

original: yon tan bshes gnyen zhes sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: yon tan bshes gnyen zhes sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so //
translated: it is not reasonable for the mind to engage with a sentient being.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i spyod pa dang 'brel ba'i 'du byed mthong na /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i spyod pa dang 'brel ba'i 'du byed mthong na /
translated: When seeing the formations associated with virtuous and nonvirtuous conduct,

original: 'du byed kyi blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs kyi /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs kyi /
translated: only the cognition of formations is appropriate,

original: byis pa dang mkhas pa zhes sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: byis pa dang mkhas pa zhes sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so //
translated: but it is not reasonable for the cognition of sentient beings, such as the childish and the wise, to occur.

original: yul la rnam par shes pa 'jug pa mthong na /
analyzed: yul la rnam par shes pa 'jug pa mthong na /
translated: When seeing the engagement of consciousness in objects,

original: sems can gyi blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs kyi /
analyzed: sems can gyi blo kho na 'jug pa'i rigs kyi /
translated: only the cognition of sentient beings is appropriate,

original: ngas mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs par sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so snyam mo //
analyzed: ngas mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs par sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i mi rigs so snyam mo //
translated: but it is not reasonable for the cognition of sentient beings, such as I see, to occur.

original: de ltar blo sngon du ma btang bar dngos po lnga po rnams la /
analyzed: de ltar blo sngon du ma btang bar dngos po lnga po rnams la /
translated: Thus, without first directing the mind,

original: rnam pa lngar sems can gyi blo kho na 'jug par 'gyur gyi 'du byed kyi blo 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa lngar sems can gyi blo kho na 'jug par 'gyur gyi 'du byed kyi blo 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: only the cognition of sentient beings occurs in the five aspects with regard to the five things, but the cognition of formations does not occur.

original: de bas na blo sngon du ma btang bar des sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i dmigs pa mthong nas /
analyzed: de bas na blo sngon du ma btang bar des sems can gyi blo 'jug pa'i dmigs pa mthong nas /
translated: Therefore, without first directing the mind, when seeing the object of the occurrence of the cognition of sentient beings,

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: he thinks this:

original: bdag yod do snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag yod do snyam mo //
translated: I exist.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks this:

original: gal te bdag med du zin na /
analyzed: gal te bdag med du zin na /
translated: If I did not exist,

original: bdag gi mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: My eyes see forms.

original: mthong ngo // mthong zin no //
analyzed: mthong ngo // mthong zin no //
translated: I see, I have seen,

original: yang na mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes de lta bu'i mngon par 'du byed pa sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: yang na mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes de lta bu'i mngon par 'du byed pa sngon du btang ste /
translated: or I will not see.

original: 'du byed rnams la blo sngon du 'gro ba'i spyod pa dmigs pa'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la blo sngon du 'gro ba'i spyod pa dmigs pa'i mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to observe that the mind engages in action in dependence on formations.

original: lta ba la ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: lta ba la ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with seeing,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: so it is with hearing, smelling, tasting, touching, and thinking.

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i las mngon bar 'du byed pa las dge ba'i las grub pa dang / mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa las mi dge ba'i las 'grub pa la sogs pa la blo sngon du btang nas spyod pa dmigs pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i las mngon bar 'du byed pa las dge ba'i las grub pa dang / mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa las mi dge ba'i las 'grub pa la sogs pa la blo sngon du btang nas spyod pa dmigs pa mi rigs te /
translated: In the same way, it is not reasonable to observe that the mind engages in action in dependence on the accomplishment of virtuous actions from the performance of virtuous actions, the accomplishment of nonvirtuous actions from the performance of nonvirtuous actions, and so on.

original: de yang 'du byed tsam 'ba' zhig gis ni mi rung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: de yang 'du byed tsam 'ba' zhig gis ni mi rung ngo snyam mo //
translated: This is not possible merely through formations alone.

original: des na de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: des na de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Therefore, he thinks,

original: bdag yod do snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag yod do snyam mo //
translated: I exist.

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: The following is stated in response to that:

original: ci gang mthong ba de nyid la sems can gyi blo 'byung ngam /
analyzed: ci gang mthong ba de nyid la sems can gyi blo 'byung ngam /
translated: Is the conception of sentient beings with respect to that which is seen generated with respect to that very thing,

original: 'on te gzhan mthong ba la gzhan la sems can gyi blo 'byung bar 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan mthong ba la gzhan la sems can gyi blo 'byung bar 'dod /
translated: or is the conception of sentient beings with respect to that which is seen generated with respect to something else?

original: gal te de nyid la 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te de nyid la 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that it is generated with respect to that very thing,

original: des na gzugs la sogs pa la sems can du phyin ci log tu gyur pas bdag yod ces byar mi rung ngo //🔽gal te @66a * //
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa la sems can du phyin ci log tu gyur pas bdag yod ces byar mi rung ngo // gal te @66a * //
translated: then it is not tenable to say that the self exists because sentient beings are mistaken with respect to form and so on.

original: gzhan la 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gzhan la 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that it is generated with respect to something else,

original: des na dbyibs dang ldan pa la bdag ces byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na dbyibs dang ldan pa la bdag ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not tenable to say that the self possesses shape.

original: dmas pa dang / mthos pa dang / rgyal rigs la sogs pa dang / byis pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin pa la yang bdag ces byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dmas pa dang / mthos pa dang / rgyal rigs la sogs pa dang / byis pa dang / mkhas pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin pa la yang bdag ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not tenable to say that the self is the support of the faculties, the support of the body, the experiencer of objects, the appropriator of the body, the one who goes and comes, the one who is high and low, the one who is a kṣatriya and so on, the one who is a child, the one who is an elder, the one who is wise, the one who is foolish, and the one who apprehends objects such as form.

original: ci chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid las sems can gyi blo 'byung ba 'am 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid las byung bar 'dod /
analyzed: ci chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid las sems can gyi blo 'byung ba 'am 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid las byung bar 'dod /
translated: Is the conception of sentient beings generated with respect to the intrinsic reality of phenomena or with respect to something else?

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo nyid las 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo nyid las 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that it is generated with respect to intrinsic reality,

original: des na gang mthong ba de nyid la blo phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag gi blo mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na gang mthong ba de nyid la blo phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag gi blo mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, since the mind would be mistaken with respect to that which is seen, it is not tenable that the mind is the self.

original: gal te gzhan las 'dod na yang /
analyzed: gal te gzhan las 'dod na yang /
translated: If you assert that the mind is the self because it is different from the body,

original: des na yul thams cad kyang yul thams cad kyi blo'i rgyur 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na yul thams cad kyang yul thams cad kyi blo'i rgyur 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not tenable that all objects are the cause of the mind that apprehends all objects.🔽Do you assert that the mind that apprehends sentient beings arises from that which is not counted as a sentient being,

original: ci sems can du bgrang bas ma yin pa la sems can du bgrang ba'i blo 'am /🔽sems can du bgrang ba la sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i blo 'am /
analyzed: ci sems can du bgrang bas ma yin pa la sems can du bgrang ba'i blo 'am / sems can du bgrang ba la sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i blo 'am /
translated: or that the mind that does not apprehend sentient beings arises from that which is counted as a sentient being,

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems can du bgrang ba la de las gzhan pa'i sems can du bgrang ba'i blo 'byung bar 'dod dam mi 'dod /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems can du bgrang ba la de las gzhan pa'i sems can du bgrang ba'i blo 'byung bar 'dod dam mi 'dod /
translated: or that the mind that apprehends sentient beings arises from that which is counted as a sentient being, or that the mind that does not apprehend sentient beings arises from that which is not counted as a sentient being, or that the mind that apprehends another sentient being arises from another sentient being?

original: gal te blo 'byung na ni /🔽des na sems can ma yin pa yang sems can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te blo 'byung na ni / des na sems can ma yin pa yang sems can du 'gyur la /
translated: If you assert that the mind arises,🔽then that which is not a sentient being would be a sentient being,

original: sems can yang sems can ma yin par 'gyur zhing de las gzhan pa'i sems can yang de las gzhan pa'i sems can du 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sems can yang sems can ma yin par 'gyur zhing de las gzhan pa'i sems can yang de las gzhan pa'i sems can du 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: and a sentient being would be that which is not a sentient being, and one sentient being would be another sentient being. Therefore, that is not tenable.

original: gal te mi 'byung na ni /
analyzed: gal te mi 'byung na ni /
translated: If it does not arise,

original: des na mngon sum gyi tshad ma la yang skur ba btab bar gyur pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyi tshad ma la yang skur ba btab bar gyur pas mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not right that you have repudiated even direct perception.

original: ci sems can gyi blo gang yin pa de mngon sum gyi don 'dzin pa 'am /
analyzed: ci sems can gyi blo gang yin pa de mngon sum gyi don 'dzin pa 'am /
translated: Do you maintain that the cognition of sentient beings apprehends the object of direct perception,

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa'i don 'dzin par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa'i don 'dzin par 'dod /
translated: or do you maintain that it apprehends the object of inference?

original: gal te mngon sum gyi don 'dzin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi don 'dzin na ni /
translated: If it apprehends the object of direct perception,

original: des na gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams nyid /
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams nyid /
translated: then the aggregates of form, etc.

original: mngon sum du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum du 'gyur gyi /
translated: would be directly perceived,

original: sems can mngon sum du mi 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sems can mngon sum du mi 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: but sentient beings would not be directly perceived.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i don 'dzin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i don 'dzin na ni /
translated: If it apprehends the object of inference,

original: des na byis pa chung du rnams kyang ma brtags par 'phral la 'jug par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na byis pa chung du rnams kyang ma brtags par 'phral la 'jug par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: then even small children would engage in it without analysis.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, this should be said:

original: ci spyod ba blo'i rgyu las byung ba 'am /
analyzed: ci spyod ba blo'i rgyu las byung ba 'am /
translated: Do you maintain that the cognition of sentient beings arises from the cause of the mind,

original: 'on te sems can gyi rgyu las byung bar 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te sems can gyi rgyu las byung bar 'dod /
translated: or do you maintain that it arises from the cause of sentient beings?

original: gal te blo'i rgyu las byung na ni /
analyzed: gal te blo'i rgyu las byung na ni /
translated: If it arises from the cause of the mind,

original: bdag gi spyod pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag gi spyod pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to say “my conduct.”

original: gal te bdag gi rgyu las byung na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi rgyu las byung na ni /
translated: If it arose from a cause of self,

original: blo @66b sngon du 'gro ba'i spyod pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //🔽ci spyod pa'i rgyu mi rtag pa 'am /
analyzed: blo @66b sngon du 'gro ba'i spyod pa zhes byar mi rung ngo // ci spyod pa'i rgyu mi rtag pa 'am /
translated: it is not suitable to say “conduct that precedes the mind.”🔽Do you assert that the cause of conduct is impermanent

original: 'on te rtag par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te rtag par 'dod /
translated: or is it permanent?

original: gal te mi rtag na ni 'gyur ba yod pas bdag gi spyod pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag na ni 'gyur ba yod pas bdag gi spyod pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is impermanent, since it would change, it is not suitable to say “my conduct.”

original: gal te rtag cing 'gyur ba med na ni /
analyzed: gal te rtag cing 'gyur ba med na ni /
translated: If it is permanent and unchanging,

original: des na 'gyur ba med pas spyod pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //🔽ci sems can rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig spyod par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: des na 'gyur ba med pas spyod pa zhes byar mi rung ngo // ci sems can rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig spyod par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: then since it is unchanging, it is not suitable to say “conduct.”🔽Do you assert that sentient beings who are of the nature of exertion engage in conduct

original: 'on te mi rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig spyod par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te mi rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig spyod par 'dod /
translated: or do you assert that sentient beings who are of the nature of nonexertion engage in conduct?

original: gal te rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni /
translated: If it is of the nature of exertion,

original: des na rtag tu spyod pa dang ldan pas yang spyod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na rtag tu spyod pa dang ldan pas yang spyod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: then since it is always endowed with conduct, it is not suitable to say “I will engage in conduct.”

original: gal te mi rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mi rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni /
translated: If it is of the nature of nonexertion,

original: des na mi rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can spyod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na mi rtsol ba'i bdag nyid can spyod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not right to say that the self, which is not an agent, acts.

original: ci rgyu yod pas sems can spyod pa'am /
analyzed: ci rgyu yod pas sems can spyod pa'am /
translated: Do you assert that sentient beings act because of a cause,

original: 'on te rgyu med par spyod par 'dod /🔽gal te rgyu yod na ni sems can gyi spyod pa la yang /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu med par spyod par 'dod / gal te rgyu yod na ni sems can gyi spyod pa la yang /
translated: or do you assert that they act without a cause?🔽If you say that they act because of a cause,

original: byed du 'jug pa gzhan zhig yod par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa gzhan zhig yod par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not right that there is another who makes them act, because sentient beings would not act of their own accord.

original: gal te rgyu med pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pa yin na ni /
translated: If you say that they act without a cause,🔽then it is not right that they act sometimes and not at other times, because they would always be acting.

original: rtag tu dus thams cad du thams cad spyod par 'gyur bas mi rung ngam ci sems can rang dbang gis spyod pa'am /
analyzed: rtag tu dus thams cad du thams cad spyod par 'gyur bas mi rung ngam ci sems can rang dbang gis spyod pa'am /
translated: Do you assert that sentient beings act of their own accord,

original: 'on te gzhan gyi dbang gis spyod par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi dbang gis spyod par 'dod /
translated: or do you assert that they act under the influence of another?

original: gal te rang dbang yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te rang dbang yod na ni /
translated: If you say that they act of their own accord,

original: bdag nyid na ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: bdag nyid na ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa'i mi rigs so //
translated: then it is not right that they act under the influence of another, because it is not reasonable that they act of their own accord and also under the influence of another.

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gis spyod na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gis spyod na ni /
translated: If you say that they act under the influence of another,

original: bdag spyod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag spyod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not right to say that the self acts.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: In response to this, the following should be stated:

original: ci phung po tsam sems can du 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: ci phung po tsam sems can du 'dogs pa'am /
translated: Is the mere collection of aggregates designated as a sentient being,

original: 'on te phung po la yod pa 'am /🔽phung po rnams dang tha dad pa 'am /
analyzed: 'on te phung po la yod pa 'am / phung po rnams dang tha dad pa 'am /
translated: or is it something that exists in the aggregates,🔽or is it something different from the aggregates,

original: phung po med pa zhig tu 'dod /
analyzed: phung po med pa zhig tu 'dod /
translated: or is it something that does not exist in the aggregates?

original: gal te phung po tsam du zad par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te phung po tsam du zad par 'dod na ni /

original: des na phung po rnams dang tha dad pa med pas bdag bden par gnas par yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na phung po rnams dang tha dad pa med pas bdag bden par gnas par yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: then since it is not different from the aggregates, it is not tenable to say that the self exists as a reality.

original: gal te pung po rnams la yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te pung po rnams la yod na ni /
translated: If it exists in the aggregates,

original: de rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa zhig yin grang ste /
analyzed: de rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa zhig yin grang ste /

original: gal te rtag na ni rtag pa la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis phan pa dang / gnod par 'gyur ba'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te rtag na ni rtag pa la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis phan pa dang / gnod par 'gyur ba'i mi rigs so //
translated: If it is permanent, then it is illogical that it is benefited or harmed by pleasure or pain.

original: phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba yang med na ni /
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba yang med na ni /
translated: If it is not benefited or harmed,

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa la 'jug pa'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa la 'jug pa'i mi rigs so //
translated: then it is illogical that it engages in virtue and vice.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa la 'jug pa med na ni /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa la 'jug pa med na ni /
translated: If it does not engage in virtue and vice,🔽then it is illogical that it experiences the results of virtue and vice.

original: @67a * // lus gtan skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: @67a * // lus gtan skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The self would not be the support of the body,

original: 'bad mi dgos par bdag rtag tu grol bar 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'bad mi dgos par bdag rtag tu grol bar 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: because it would be liberated without effort, since it is permanent.

original: gal te mi rtag na ni /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag na ni /
translated: If it were impermanent,

original: 'du byed rnams las logs shig dang / 'jig pa dang skye ba rgyun gyis 'jug pa yang mi dmigs pas mi rung la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams las logs shig dang / 'jig pa dang skye ba rgyun gyis 'jug pa yang mi dmigs pas mi rung la /
translated: it would not be tenable that the self is different from the formations, because it would not be observed to engage in the process of destruction and origination.

original: 'dir zhig par gyur pa gzhan du ma byas par thob pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir zhig par gyur pa gzhan du ma byas par thob pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: And it would not be tenable that the self is permanent, because it would be subject to the error of being destroyed here and arising elsewhere.

original: gal te phung po rnams dang tha dad na ni /
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams dang tha dad na ni /
translated: If it were different from the aggregates,

original: des na sems can 'du ma byas zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na sems can 'du ma byas zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: it would not be tenable that the self is unconditioned.

original: gal te phung po med pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te phung po med pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If it were devoid of the aggregates,

original: des na lus dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rtag tu kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur bas bdag ces byar mi rung ngo //🔽ci lta ba po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin nam /
analyzed: des na lus dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rtag tu kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur bas bdag ces byar mi rung ngo // ci lta ba po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin nam /
translated: it would not be tenable that it is the self, because it would be permanent and not related to the body.🔽Is the characteristic of the seer and so on the same as the self?

original: 'on te de dang tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te de dang tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin par 'dod /

original: gal te lta ba po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te lta ba po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin na ni /

original: des na ci lta ba la sogs pa la lta ba la sogs par btags nas lta ba po'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: des na ci lta ba la sogs pa la lta ba la sogs par btags nas lta ba po'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'am /

original: 'on te de dag dang tha dad pa zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te de dag dang tha dad pa zhig yin /

original: gal te lta ba la sogs pa la gdags na ni /
analyzed: gal te lta ba la sogs pa la gdags na ni /
translated: If they are imputed to seeing and so on,

original: des na lta ba la sogs pa rnams nyid lta ba por gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na lta ba la sogs pa rnams nyid lta ba por gyur gyi /

original: bdag ni lta ba la sogs pa dang bye brag med pas lta ba bor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag ni lta ba la sogs pa dang bye brag med pas lta ba bor mi rung ngo //

original: gal te de dag dang tha dad na ni /
analyzed: gal te de dag dang tha dad na ni /
translated: If they are different,

original: des na lta ba la sogs pa de dag bdag gi las sam byed pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: des na lta ba la sogs pa de dag bdag gi las sam byed pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: then seeing and so on would be the action or the agent of the self.

original: gal te las yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te las yin na ni /
translated: If they are the action,

analyzed: de yang sa bon dang 'dra bas des ni mi rtag par 'gyur te mi rung ngo //
translated: then since they are like seeds, they would be impermanent, but that is unacceptable.

analyzed: gal te rdza mkhan la sogs pa tha snyad du gdags pa'i mi lta bu zhig yin na ni /
translated: If they are like a person who is imputed conventionally, like a potter and so on,🔽then the self would be a nonthing.

original: des na mi rtag pa dang / kun rdzob tu gyur pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa dang / kun rdzob tu gyur pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that space is permanent and a real entity.

original: gal te rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad du gdags pa'i mi lta bu zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i tha snyad du gdags pa'i mi lta bu zhig yin na ni /

original: des na mi rtag pa dang / kun rdzob tu yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa dang / kun rdzob tu yang 'gyur la /
translated: then it would be impermanent and a real entity.

analyzed: de don thams cad la 'dod dgur byed par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //

original: gal te sa lta bu zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te sa lta bu zhig yin na ni /

original: des na mi rtag par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na mi rtag par yang 'gyur la /

original: sa ltar las gsal ba yang ma yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sa ltar las gsal ba yang ma yin pas mi rung ngo //

original: 'di ltar sa'i las ni gsal bar dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa'i las ni gsal bar dmigs te /

original: de'i dbang gis thur du mi ltung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis thur du mi ltung ba yin no //

original: gal te nam mkha' lta bu @67b zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' lta bu @67b zhig yin na ni /

analyzed: des ni gzugs med pa tsam la nam mkhar gdags par zad pas mi rung ngo //

original: gdags pas yod pa'i tshul gyis yod pa zhig yin yang /
analyzed: gdags pas yod pa'i tshul gyis yod pa zhig yin yang /

original: de'i las ni gsal bar dmigs la /
analyzed: de'i las ni gsal bar dmigs la /

original: bdag gi ni de lta ma yin pas mi rung ste //
analyzed: bdag gi ni de lta ma yin pas mi rung ste //

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' las ni gsal bar dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' las ni gsal bar dmigs te /

analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba la sogs pa'i las 'jug ste /
translated: Due to its power, the actions of coming, going, bending, stretching, and so on occur.

original: de bas na las yin zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na las yin zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that it is an action.

original: gal te byed pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te byed pa yin na ni /
translated: If it is an agent,

original: des na gal te zor ba la sogs pa dang 'dra na /
analyzed: des na gal te zor ba la sogs pa dang 'dra na /
translated: then if it is like a saw,🔽then just as a saw performs the action of cutting something else,

original: des na ji ltar zor ba la sogs pas gzhan gcad pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa de bzhin du /🔽lta ba la sogs pa las /
analyzed: des na ji ltar zor ba la sogs pas gzhan gcad pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa de bzhin du / lta ba la sogs pa las /
translated: in the same way,

analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa tha dad pa gzhan mi dmigs pas mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not tenable that it is observed that something other than seeing, such as the self, performs the action of seeing.

original: gal te me lta bu zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te me lta bu zhig yin na ni /
translated: If it is like fire,

original: des na bdag tu rtog pa don med par 'gyur bas mi rung ste /
analyzed: des na bdag tu rtog pa don med par 'gyur bas mi rung ste /
translated: then it is not tenable that it is the self because the conception of the self would be pointless.🔽Thus, fire burns

original: 'di ltar me ni sreg pa po med par yang /🔽bdag nyid kyis sreg par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar me ni sreg pa po med par yang /🔽bdag nyid kyis sreg par byed do //

original: gal te lta ba po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las gzhan zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te lta ba po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las gzhan zhig yin na ni /

analyzed: des na tshad ma thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid la bdag ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: then it would be unsuitable to call it the self, which has the characteristic of being devoid of all valid cognitions.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the following should be stated:

analyzed: ci gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de / kun nas nyon mongs pa 'am /
translated: Is that which possesses the characteristics of defilement and purification

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ram /
translated: defiled or purified?

original: 'on te de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa de ltar 'gyur bar 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa de ltar 'gyur bar 'dod /
translated: Or do you assert that that which lacks those characteristics is so?

original: gal te gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /🔽rnam par byang bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de kun nas nyon mongs pa'am / rnam par byang bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: If that which possesses the characteristics of defilement and purification is defiled or purified,🔽then in that case,

analyzed: des na 'du byed gang yin pa rnams la /
translated: with regard to any formations,

analyzed: yams kyi nad dang / gnod pa dang / 'go ba'i nad rnams dang / de zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dag dmigs te /

analyzed: 'du byed de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Those formations are endowed with the characteristics of defilement and purification.

original: de bas na bdag med par yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bas na bdag med par yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that they are without a self,

analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams dang / nang gi lus de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: because external things and the internal body are defiled and purified.

original: gal te de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa yin na ni /
translated: If they are not endowed with those characteristics,

original: des @68a * //
analyzed: des @68a * //

analyzed: na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i bdag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //

analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste / ci gang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de 'jug kyang 'jug la ldog kyang ldog par 'gyur ram /

analyzed: 'on te de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa de ltar 'gyur bar 'dod /
translated: Is it the case that that which is endowed with the characteristics of engagement is engaged and disengaged, and that which is not endowed with those characteristics is not?🔽Or is it maintained that it is not so?

analyzed: gal te gang mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de de ltar 'gyur na ni /

analyzed: des na 'du byed rnams la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga dmigs te /

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it is like this:

analyzed: 'du byed lus dang / myu gu dang / chu klung dang / mar me dang / bya ba dang / bzhon pa'i rgyun rnams la dmigs te /

analyzed: des na bdag med par yang 'du byed rnams nyid 'jug cing ldog pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //

original: gal te de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa zhig yin na ni /

analyzed: des na 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i bdag nyid 'jug cing ldog par 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ngo //

analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /

original: byed pa po 'am /
analyzed: byed pa po 'am /

original: grol pa por 'dod dam /
analyzed: grol pa por 'dod dam /

original: 'on te mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de de ltar 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de de ltar 'dod /

original: gal te 'gyur ba de la de ltar 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'gyur ba de la de ltar 'dod na ni /
translated: If that which is changing is asserted in that way,

translated: then since the formations themselves would be the experiencer, the agent, and the liberator, it is not tenable that the self is impermanent.

original: gal te 'gyur ba med pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'gyur ba med pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If it is unchanging,

analyzed: des na zab po dang / byed pa po dang / grol ba po bdag yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then the self would be the experiencer, the agent, and the liberator.

original: 'gyur ba med par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med par mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that it is unchanging.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is also to be said:

original: ci bdag nyid la byed pa por 'dogs pa 'am /
analyzed: ci bdag nyid la byed pa por 'dogs pa 'am /

original: 'on te bdag las gzhan pa la yang 'dogs par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te bdag las gzhan pa la yang 'dogs par 'dod /

analyzed: @68b gal te bdag nyid la 'dogs na ni / me sreg par byed do //
translated: If it is made in reference to itself,🔽it would be incorrect to say, “Fire is that which burns,”

original: 'od snang bar byed do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'od snang bar byed do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: or “The sun is that which illuminates.”

original: gal te gzhan la yang 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la yang 'dogs na ni /

analyzed: des na lta ba la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams la yang /

analyzed: byed pa por 'dogs pas bdag tu rtog pa don med par 'gyur te mi rung ngo//

analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste / ci bdag nyid la bdag tu 'dogs pa 'am /
translated: In this regard, the following should be stated:🔽Is the designation of the self as an agent made in reference to itself?

original: 'on te gzhan la yang 'dogs par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la yang 'dogs par 'dod /
translated: Or is it made in reference to something other than the self?

original: gal te bdag nyid la 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid la 'dogs na ni /
translated: If it is made in reference to itself,

original: des na tha snyad du gdags pa'i mi'i lus la yon tan bshes gnyen dang / sangs rgyas byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gdags su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na tha snyad du gdags pa'i mi'i lus la yon tan bshes gnyen dang / sangs rgyas byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gdags su mi rung ngo //
translated: then it would be incorrect to designate the human body conventionally as “the one who has good qualities,” “the one who has friends,” “the one who has the Buddha nature,” and so on.

original: gal te gzhan la 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la 'dogs na ni /
translated: If it is made in reference to something other than the self,🔽then the designation of the self as an agent would be purposeless.

original: des na 'du byed tsam la bdag tu 'dogs par zad de /
analyzed: des na 'du byed tsam la bdag tu 'dogs par zad de /
translated: Therefore, the self is merely a designation for the mere collection of formations.

original: bdag tu rtog pa don med par 'gyur bas mi rung ste /
analyzed: bdag tu rtog pa don med par 'gyur bas mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to be a mere designation because it would be pointless to imagine a self.

original: 'di ltar 'di na tha snyad du gdags pa'i mi nyid /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na tha snyad du gdags pa'i mi nyid /
translated: In this way, the humanness that is designated conventionally

original: bdag la yang sems can no snyam du sems la /
analyzed: bdag la yang sems can no snyam du sems la /
translated: is also conceived of as a sentient being in relation to the self,

original: gzhan dag la yang rnam par ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rnam par ston par byed do //
translated: and it is also taught to others.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the following should be stated:

original: ci bdag tu lta ba gang yin pa 'di dge ba 'am mi dge bar 'dod /
analyzed: ci bdag tu lta ba gang yin pa 'di dge ba 'am mi dge bar 'dod /
translated: Is this view of the self considered to be virtuous or nonvirtuous?

original: gal te dge ba yin na des na rmongs pa rnams la shas cher lhag par skye ba dang / sbyor ba med bar yang skye ba dang / thar pa la skrag par byed pa dang / nyes pa gso bar byed pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te dge ba yin na des na rmongs pa rnams la shas cher lhag par skye ba dang / sbyor ba med bar yang skye ba dang / thar pa la skrag par byed pa dang / nyes pa gso bar byed pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is virtuous, then it is not suitable because it arises predominantly in the ignorant, it arises even without application, it causes fear of liberation, and it causes the concealment of faults.

original: gal te mi dge ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mi dge ba yin na ni /
translated: If it is nonvirtuous,

original: des na de lta yin na phyin ci ma log pa zhes byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: des na de lta yin na phyin ci ma log pa zhes byar mi rung ste /
translated: then it is not suitable to be called nonerroneous.

original: de la phyin ci log yod par gyur na bdag yod ces byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la phyin ci log yod par gyur na bdag yod ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it were to have error, it would not be tenable to say that the self exists.

original: ci bdag med par lta ba dge ba 'am mi dge ba yin par 'dod /
analyzed: ci bdag med par lta ba dge ba 'am mi dge ba yin par 'dod /
translated: Do you assert that the view of selflessness is virtuous or nonvirtuous?

original: gal te dge ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te dge ba yin na ni /
translated: If it is virtuous,

original: des na bdag bde bar gnas pa yod par gyur na /
analyzed: des na bdag bde bar gnas pa yod par gyur na /
translated: then if the self exists in a state of ease,

original: bdag med par lta ba dge ba phyin ci ma log pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag med par lta ba dge ba phyin ci ma log pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: it would not be tenable to say that the view of selflessness is virtuous and nonerroneous.

original: gal te mi dge ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mi dge ba yin na ni /
translated: If it is nonvirtuous,

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa dang / sbyor ba las skyes pa dang / thar pa la skrag par mi byed pa dang / dkar po'i 'bras bu 'phral du thob par byed pa dang / nyes pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa dang / sbyor ba las skyes pa dang / thar pa la skrag par mi byed pa dang / dkar po'i 'bras bu 'phral du thob par byed pa dang / nyes pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: then it would not be tenable to say that it is taught by the Omniscient One, that it arises from application, that it does not cause fear of liberation, that it causes the immediate attainment of the fruit of virtue, and that it is the antidote to faults.

original: ci bdag nyid la bdag yod do snyam du sems sam 'on te bdag tu lta ba yin par 'dod /
analyzed: ci bdag nyid la bdag yod do snyam du sems sam 'on te bdag tu lta ba yin par 'dod /
translated: Do you think that the thought “I exist” is the view of the self or is it the self?

original: gal te @69a * //🔽bdag kho na'o snyam du sems na ni /
analyzed: gal te @69a * //🔽bdag kho na'o snyam du sems na ni /
translated: If it is the self,🔽then it would not be tenable to say that the self is not a knower of itself.

original: des na nams kyang bdag med do snyam pa'i blo 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na nams kyang bdag med do snyam pa'i blo 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not right to think that the self does not exist at all.

original: gal te bdag tu lta ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu lta ba yin na ni /
translated: If it were the view of self,

original: des na bdag med bzhin du 'du byed tsam la bdag tu lta ba'i dbang gis bdag yod do snyam du sems pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: des na bdag med bzhin du 'du byed tsam la bdag tu lta ba'i dbang gis bdag yod do snyam du sems pa mi rung ste /
translated: then it would not be right to think that the self exists due to the power of the view of the mere aggregates as a self, when in fact there is no self.

original: de'i phyir yang bdag yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang bdag yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not right to say that the self exists.🔽Thus, the presentation of the self is not for the purpose of engaging the mind in the view of the self, nor for the purpose of disengaging the mind from the view of the self, nor for the purpose of engaging the mind in the view of selflessness, nor for the purpose of disengaging the mind from the view of selflessness.🔽The presentation of the self is not for the purpose of engaging the mind in the view of the aggregates, nor for the purpose of disengaging the mind from the view of the aggregates.

original: de ltar na blo sngon du ma btang bar de'i blo 'jug pa dang / blo sngon du btang ste spyod pa ston pa dang / phung po rnams la 'dogs pa dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /🔽rnam par byang pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / zab po dang / byed pa po dang / grol ba po rnam par gzhag pa dang / byed pa por 'dogs pa dang / brjod par 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na blo sngon du ma btang bar de'i blo 'jug pa dang / blo sngon du btang ste spyod pa ston pa dang / phung po rnams la 'dogs pa dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /🔽rnam par byang pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / zab po dang / byed pa po dang / grol ba po rnam par gzhag pa dang / byed pa por 'dogs pa dang / brjod par 'dogs pa dang /
translated: The presentation of the self is not for the purpose of engaging the mind in the view of the elements, nor for the purpose of disengaging the mind from the view of the elements.🔽The presentation of the self is not for the purpose of engaging the mind in the view of the sense spheres, nor for the purpose of disengaging the mind from the view of the sense spheres.🔽The presentation of the self is not for the purpose of engaging the mind in the view of dependent origination, nor for the purpose of disengaging the mind from the view of dependent origination.🔽The presentation of the self is not for the purpose of engaging the mind in the view of the truths, nor for the purpose of disengaging the mind from the view of the truths.🔽The presentation of the self is not for the purpose of engaging the mind in the view of the perfections, nor for the purpose of disengaging the mind from the view of the perfections.🔽The presentation of the self is not for the purpose of engaging the mind in the view of the factors for awakening, nor for the purpose of disengaging the mind from the view of the factors for awakening.🔽The presentation of the self is not for the purpose of engaging the mind in the view of the levels, nor for the purpose of disengaging the mind from the view of the levels.🔽The presentation of the self is not for the purpose of engaging the mind in the view of the meditative stabilizations, nor for the purpose of disengaging the mind from the view of the meditative

original: lta ba 'dogs pas kyang bdag yod par mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: lta ba 'dogs pas kyang bdag yod par mi rung ngo ;
translated: Also, it is not suitable to impute the self to the view.

original: / yang yang dag pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: / yang yang dag pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: The characteristics of the true self should be explained.

original: chos rnams la bdag 'dogs la /
analyzed: chos rnams la bdag 'dogs la /
translated: The self is imputed to phenomena,

original: de rdzas su 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir de dag las tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de rdzas su 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir de dag las tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: but because it could become a substance, it should not be described as either different from them or not different.

original: yang na chos de dag bdag gi mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na chos de dag bdag gi mtshan nyid kho na yin te /
translated: Or, those phenomena are the characteristics of the self,

original: yang mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mi brtan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / skye ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: yang mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mi brtan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / skye ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang /
translated: the characteristic of impermanence, the characteristic of instability, the characteristic of unreliability, the characteristic of change, the characteristic of the phenomena of birth, the characteristic of the phenomena of aging, sickness, and death,

original: chos tsam gyi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos tsam gyi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: the characteristic of mere phenomena, and the characteristic of suffering.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān also said:

original: dge slong dag khyod kyi chos kyi bdag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyod kyi chos kyi bdag ni 'di yin te /
translated: Monks, this is your self, which is a dharma.

original: dge slong khyod kyi bdag ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong khyod kyi bdag ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Monks, your self is impermanent.

original: dge slong khyod kyi bdag ni mi brtan pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽yang rgyu rnam pa bzhis na /
analyzed: dge slong khyod kyi bdag ni mi brtan pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // yang rgyu rnam pa bzhis na /
translated: Monks, your self is unstable, unreliable, and subject to change.

original: 'du byed rnams la sems can 'dogs par rig par bya sta /🔽tha snyad la bde bar bya ba dang / 'jig rten dang mthun par bya ba dang / sems can gyi dngos po rnam pa thams cad kyis med do snyam ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la sems can 'dogs par rig par bya sta / tha snyad la bde bar bya ba dang / 'jig rten dang mthun par bya ba dang / sems can gyi dngos po rnam pa thams cad kyis med do snyam ste /
translated: Moreover, the sentient beings are designated in four ways with regard to the formations.

original: skrag pa la gsal ba @69b dang bdag dang / pha rol la tha snyad kyis yon tan dang ldan pa dang / skyon dang ldan par yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skrag pa la gsal ba @69b dang bdag dang / pha rol la tha snyad kyis yon tan dang ldan pa dang / skyon dang ldan par yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to facilitate conventional usage, to conform with the world, and to generate conviction in the qualities and faults of oneself and others, in order to generate conviction in the qualities and faults of oneself and others through conventional usage, and in order to generate conviction in the qualities and faults of others through conventional usage.

original: de bas na bdag tu smra ba yang rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag tu smra ba yang rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the doctrine of self is not generated by reasoning.

original: rtag par smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtag par smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the doctrine of eternalism?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'di na dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'di na dge sbyong ngam /
translated: It is as follows:🔽Here, some ascetics and brahmins

original: bram ze kha cig ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bram ze kha cig ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: are just as before.

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa ste /
translated: They hold that the self and the world are permanent,

original: byas pa ma yin pa dang / byas pas byas pa ma yin pa dang / sprul pa ma yin pa dang / sprul pas byas pa ma yin pa dang / gsad du med pa dang / ther zug tu gnas pa dang / srog shing ltar brtan par gnas pa'o snyam du 'dzin to /
analyzed: byas pa ma yin pa dang / byas pas byas pa ma yin pa dang / sprul pa ma yin pa dang / sprul pas byas pa ma yin pa dang / gsad du med pa dang / ther zug tu gnas pa dang / srog shing ltar brtan par gnas pa'o snyam du 'dzin to /
translated: not made, not made by anything, not transformed, not transformed by anything, not perishable, enduring, stable, and persisting as an eternal monolith.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽rtag par smra ba dang / kha cig rtag par 'dzin pa sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa rnams dang / phyi ma'i mtha' la rtog pa 'du shes can du smra ba rnams dang / 'du shes can ma yin par smra ba rnams dang / 'du shes can ma yin par smra ba rnams dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / rtag par smra ba dang / kha cig rtag par 'dzin pa sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa rnams dang / phyi ma'i mtha' la rtog pa 'du shes can du smra ba rnams dang / 'du shes can ma yin par smra ba rnams dang / 'du shes can ma yin par smra ba rnams dang /
translated: It is as follows:🔽Those who propound eternalism, those who hold some views about the past, those who propound consciousness, those who propound non-consciousness, those who propound neither consciousness nor non-consciousness,

original: 'du shes yod pa yang ma yin 'du shes med pa yang ma yin par smra pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'du shes yod pa yang ma yin 'du shes med pa yang ma yin par smra pa rnams so //
translated: and those who propound the annihilation of the self at death.

original: yang na kha cig ni rdul phra mo rtag par 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang na kha cig ni rdul phra mo rtag par 'dzin to //
translated: Some hold that the subtle atom is permanent.

original: ci'i phyir bdag dang 'jig rten rtag go zhes de ltar lta zhing ji skad smra zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag dang 'jig rten rtag go zhes de ltar lta zhing ji skad smra zhe na /
translated: Why do they view and proclaim that the self and the world are permanent?

original: de'i gtan tshigs ni mdo 'di nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs ni mdo 'di nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The reason should be understood according to the sutra, as is appropriate.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa rnams kyis ni /
translated: Among them, those who speculate about the prior limit

original: bsam gtan chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po la brten nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po la brten nas /
translated: , on the basis of the lesser, middling, and greater meditative absorptions,

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pas 'das pa'i dus la sngon gyi mthar rtog ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pas 'das pa'i dus la sngon gyi mthar rtog ste /
translated: recall their former abodes and speculate about the prior limit in terms of the past.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mi mkhas pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mi mkhas pa /
translated: They are unskilled in dependent origination.

original: 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la dran pa tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa rnams la lta bar gyur pa de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la dran pa tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa rnams la lta bar gyur pa de 'byung ngo //
translated: They do not understand as it really is that the recollection of past conditioning is merely memory.

original: yang na lha'i mig la brten nas da ltar gyi dus la sngon gyi mthar rtog pa /
analyzed: yang na lha'i mig la brten nas da ltar gyi dus la sngon gyi mthar rtog pa /
translated: Or, on the basis of the divine eye, they speculate about the prior limit in terms of the present.

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig gis 'jig pas rjes su 'jug pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa rnams dang / 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du rnam par shes pa'i rgyud kyis rgyun dmigs pa rnams la lta bar gyur pa de 'byung ngo //🔽tshangs pas rang gi yid la bsams pa grub pa dmigs pa dang / 'byung ba chen po rnam par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par 'gyur bar dmigs pa dang / phyi @70a * //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig gis 'jig pas rjes su 'jug pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa rnams dang / 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du rnam par shes pa'i rgyud kyis rgyun dmigs pa rnams la lta bar gyur pa de 'byung ngo // tshangs pas rang gi yid la bsams pa grub pa dmigs pa dang / 'byung ba chen po rnam par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par 'gyur bar dmigs pa dang / phyi @70a * //
translated: Those who do not know the correct way of following the momentary destruction of conditioned things, and those who see the continuity of the stream of consciousness from this world to the next world, have this view.

original: ma'i mthar 'du shes pa dang tshor ba tha dad bar ni mthong la /
analyzed: ma'i mthar 'du shes pa dang tshor ba tha dad bar ni mthong la /
translated: Brahma, having attained his own thought, sees the continuity of the great elements and the continuity of consciousness, and sees the distinction of perception and feeling in the future.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad par ni ma mthong ba la lta bar gyur pa de 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad par ni ma mthong ba la lta bar gyur pa de 'byung ste /
translated: He sees the distinction of characteristics, but does not see the distinction of substance.🔽This view arises in him.

original: des na de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: des na de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks:

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag go snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag go snyam mo //
translated: “The self and the world are permanent.”

original: rdul phra mo rtag par 'dzin pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan la brten nas /
analyzed: rdul phra mo rtag par 'dzin pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan la brten nas /
translated: Grasping the atom as permanent, based on worldly concentration,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes pas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes pas /
translated: Because they do not understand dependent origination as it really is,

original: 'di ltar lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar lta ste /
translated: they have this view:

original: dngos po sngon du 'gro na dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu bsags pa 'byung la 'bri ba sngon du 'gro na 'jig par rtog ste /
analyzed: dngos po sngon du 'gro na dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu bsags pa 'byung la 'bri ba sngon du 'gro na 'jig par rtog ste /
translated: “If a thing precedes, then the accumulation of the effect of things occurs. If a decrease precedes, then destruction occurs.”

original: des na de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: des na de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Therefore, they think this:

original: rdul phra mo rnams las ni rdzas rags pa 'byung la /
analyzed: rdul phra mo rnams las ni rdzas rags pa 'byung la /
translated: “Coarse things arise from subtle atoms.

original: rdzas rags pa rnam par bshig na ni rdul phra mo'i so na gnas te /
analyzed: rdzas rags pa rnam par bshig na ni rdul phra mo'i so na gnas te /
translated: When coarse things are destroyed, the subtle atoms remain.

original: de bas na rja sa rags pa ni mi rtag la rdul phra mo rnams ni rtag go snyam mo //
analyzed: de bas na rja sa rags pa ni mi rtag la rdul phra mo rnams ni rtag go snyam mo //
translated: Therefore, coarse things are impermanent, but subtle atoms are permanent.”

original: de la rtag par lta ba sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa rnams dang / phyi ma'i mtha' la rtog pa rnams ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rtag par lta ba sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa rnams dang / phyi ma'i mtha' la rtog pa rnams ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, those who speculate about the prior limit, having a view of permanence, and those who speculate about the later limit are included in the characteristics of the distinctions.

original: bdag tu smra ba sun phyung bas bdag gi bye brag gi mtshan nyid du smra ba yang sun phyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba sun phyung bas bdag gi bye brag gi mtshan nyid du smra ba yang sun phyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the refutation of the assertions about the self also refutes the assertions about the distinctions of the self.

original: gzhan yang de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this should be said to them:

original: ci sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa /🔽phung po 'dzin pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa / phung po 'dzin pa yin nam /
translated: Is the recollection of former abodes

original: bdag 'dzin pa yin par 'dod /
analyzed: bdag 'dzin pa yin par 'dod /
translated: the apprehension of the aggregates or the apprehension of a self?

original: gal te phung po 'dzin pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te phung po 'dzin pa yin na ni /
translated: If it is the apprehension of the aggregates,

original: bdag dang 'jig rten rtag go zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten rtag go zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not tenable to say that the self and the world are permanent.

original: gal te bdag 'dzin pa yin na ni /🔽des na sems can de dag ni che ge mo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gal te bdag 'dzin pa yin na ni / des na sems can de dag ni che ge mo zhes bya ste /
translated: If it is the apprehension of a self,🔽then it is not tenable to say, “Those sentient beings were such and such,”

original: der bdag gi ming 'di zhes bya ba dang / rigs 'di zhes bya bar gyur to zhes rgyas bar brjod par mi rung ngo //
