analyzed: bzhin te / skyes bu gang zag 'dis myong ba gang ci yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Whatever experiences this person has

original: sdug bsngal las bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las bsams pa'o //
translated: is in terms of suffering.

original: sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Arising from a previously created cause

original: sdig pa'i rgyu las byung ba las bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i rgyu las byung ba las bsams pa'o //
translated: is in terms of the cause of misdeeds.

original: 'di ltar las rnying rnams ni dka' thub kyis 'byang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar las rnying rnams ni dka' thub kyis 'byang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, old karma is purified by austerities.

original: tshe 'di nyid la drag po spyod pa las bsams pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la drag po spyod pa las bsams pa'o //
translated: This refers to the practice of asceticism in this very life.

original: las gsar rnams ni mi bya ba dang / chu lon gyis dag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las gsar rnams ni mi bya ba dang / chu lon gyis dag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: New karma is not created and is purified by a dam.

original: mi dge ba rnams las bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams las bsams pa'o //
translated: This refers to nonvirtue.🔽Thus, there is no later leakage of faults.

original: de lta na phyis nyes 'dzag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gcig tu nges par dge ba nyid yin pas phyis nyes 'dzag tu mi 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na phyis nyes 'dzag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gcig tu nges par dge ba nyid yin pas phyis nyes 'dzag tu mi 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This refers to the certainty of virtue alone, so there is no later leakage of faults.

original: nyes 'dzag med na las zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyes 'dzag med na las zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When there is no leakage of faults, karma is exhausted.

original: sdig pa las bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa las bsams pa'o //
translated: This refers to evil.

original: las zad na sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: las zad na sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: When karma is exhausted, suffering is exhausted.

original: sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / tshe 'di'i gnod pa las byung ba las bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / tshe 'di'i gnod pa las byung ba las bsams pa'o //
translated: This refers to suffering that arises from causes created in the past and suffering that arises from harm in this life.

original: sdug bsngal zad na sdug bsngal mthar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad na sdug bsngal mthar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When suffering is exhausted, suffering is brought to an end.

original: tshe gzhan gyi rgyun 'jug pa las bsams pa ste /
analyzed: tshe gzhan gyi rgyun 'jug pa las bsams pa ste /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas consider that the continuum of the life force is the cause of the world.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They say:

original: gcer bu pa dag lta bu'o //🔽ci'i phyir 'di ltar lta zhing /
analyzed: gcer bu pa dag lta bu'o // ci'i phyir 'di ltar lta zhing /
translated: The world is produced from the self.

original: 'di skad smra zhe na /
analyzed: 'di skad smra zhe na /
translated: Why do they view and speak in this way?

original: lung dang rigs pas byed de /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas byed de /
translated: They do so on the basis of scripture and reasoning.

original: lung ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lung ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Their scripture is the same as before.

original: rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is their reasoning?

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig rtog ge ba yin te zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig rtog ge ba yin te zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: They say: “Some people are logicians.

original: tshe 'di'i skyes bu'i byed pa la 'khrul par yod par mthong ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i skyes bu'i byed pa la 'khrul par yod par mthong ste /
translated: They see that there is confusion regarding the actions of people in this life.

original: 'di ltar nges 'jig rten na yang dag par sbyor ba dang ldan pa la yang sdug bsngal skye ba dang / log pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa la yang bde bar skye bar mthong nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar nges 'jig rten na yang dag par sbyor ba dang ldan pa la yang sdug bsngal skye ba dang / log pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa la yang bde bar skye bar mthong nas /
translated: They see that in this world, suffering arises for those who are engaged in correct practice, and happiness arises for those who are engaged in incorrect practice.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /🔽gal te 'di skyes bu'i byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te / gal te 'di skyes bu'i byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni /
translated: They think:🔽If this were caused by the actions of people,

original: 'di las log par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: 'di las log par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: then it would be reasonable for the opposite to occur.

original: 'di ltar de log par yang ma gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de log par yang ma gyur te /
translated: But this has not happened.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no snyam ste /
translated: Therefore, this is the result of a cause created in the past.

original: des na 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad smra bar gyur to //
analyzed: des na 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad smra bar gyur to //
translated: Thus, he views and speaks in this way.

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: In response to this, the following should be said:

original: ci tshe 'di'i gnod pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: ci tshe 'di'i gnod pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin pa'am /
translated: Is the suffering that arises from harm in this life the result of a cause created in the past?

original: 'on te tshe 'di'i gnod pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te tshe 'di'i gnod pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin /
translated: Or does it arise from the cause of harm in this life?

original: gal te @72b sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te @72b sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni /
translated: If it is the result of a cause created in the past,

original: des na las rnying rnams ni dka' thub kyis 'byang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na las rnying rnams ni dka' thub kyis 'byang bar 'gyur la /
translated: then it is not tenable to say that austerities purify old karma

original: da ltar byung ba rnams ni mi bya ba dang chu lon gyis bkag na de ltar phyis nyes 'dzag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par 'byung ba mi rung ngo //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams ni mi bya ba dang chu lon gyis bkag na de ltar phyis nyes 'dzag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par 'byung ba mi rung ngo //
translated: and that if one does not commit new karma and blocks it with a dike, then later on one will not be harmed by the downpour of evil.

original: gal te tshe 'di'i gnod pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te tshe 'di'i gnod pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni /
translated: If it arises from the cause of harm in this life,

original: skyes bu gang zag 'dis myong ba gang ci yang rung /
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag 'dis myong ba gang ci yang rung /
translated: then whatever suffering this person experiences

original: de thams cad ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o zhes byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de thams cad ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o zhes byar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not right to say that all of this suffering arises from a cause that was previously created.

original: de ltar na gnod pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal ni sngon las byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / skyes bu byed pa'i rgyu las byung bar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gnod pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal ni sngon las byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / skyes bu byed pa'i rgyu las byung bar yang mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, the suffering that arises from harm is not right to say that it arises from a cause that was previously created or that it arises from a cause that is a person’s action.

original: de bas na smra ba 'di yang rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na smra ba 'di yang rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this statement is not generated by reasoning.

original: de lta mod kyi sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung bar gcig tu nges pa'i sdug bsngal yang yod de /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung bar gcig tu nges pa'i sdug bsngal yang yod de /
translated: However, there is also suffering that is definitely only caused by a previously created cause.

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig rang gi las kyi dbang gis ngan song rnams dang / rigs ngan rnams dang // sdug bsngal ba'i khyim rnams su skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig rang gi las kyi dbang gis ngan song rnams dang / rigs ngan rnams dang // sdug bsngal ba'i khyim rnams su skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in this world, some people, by the power of their own actions, are born in the lower realms, in low castes, and in poor families.

original: 'dres pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yang yod de /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yang yod de /
translated: There is also suffering that arises from a mixed cause.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: rgyal po la g-yos brten pa /
analyzed: rgyal po la g-yos brten pa /
translated: a king’s cook

original: de ni 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yin no //
translated: This is suffering that arises from a cause that is not a result.

original: rgyal po la brten pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyal po la brten pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as in the case of the king,

original: khyim pa'i las byed pa dang / zhing las dang rku ba'i las dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa la 'jug pa rnams la yang /
analyzed: khyim pa'i las byed pa dang / zhing las dang rku ba'i las dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa la 'jug pa rnams la yang /
translated: so too in the case of the householder, the farmer, the thief, and the benefactor.

original: bsod nams dang ldan pa'i 'grub par 'gyur gyi bsod nams med pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa'i ni 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ldan pa'i 'grub par 'gyur gyi bsod nams med pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa'i ni 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The action of a meritorious person is fruitful, but the action of a non-meritorious person is fruitless.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa'i rgyu las byung bar gcig tu nges pa yang yod de /
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa'i rgyu las byung bar gcig tu nges pa yang yod de /
translated: There is action which is exclusively the effect of the person.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: las gsar srid pa gzhan 'phen par byed pa /
analyzed: las gsar srid pa gzhan 'phen par byed pa /
translated: the action which projects a new existence,

original: dam pa'i chos nyan cing chos rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang / spyod lam byed pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rnams slob pa dang / de lta bu'i dang mthun pa rnams ni skyes bu'i byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan cing chos rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang / spyod lam byed pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rnams slob pa dang / de lta bu'i dang mthun pa rnams ni skyes bu'i byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: the action of listening to the Good Doctrine, the action of understanding the Truths, the action of the postures, the action of the creative arts and crafts, and similar actions.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa por smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa por smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the theory of īśvara, etc. as a cause?

original: 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig ces bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig ces bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Here, some brahmans and some ascetics, as before,🔽

original: skyes bu gang zag 'dis myong ba gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag 'dis myong ba gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: “Here, some śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas say, as above, that whatever experiences this person experiences

original: de dag thams cad ni dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba'am /🔽skyes bu gzhan gyis sprul pa'i @73a * //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba'am / skyes bu gzhan gyis sprul pa'i @73a * //
translated: all arise from a cause created by Īśvara,

original: rgyu las byung ba la sogs pa ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba la sogs pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: or they arise from a cause created by another person, and so on.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba rnams so //
translated: For example, those who say that Īśvara and so on are the cause of the world are not in agreement.
